Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_advect()

void module_advect ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Advances particle positions using different advection schemes.

This function updates the positions of atmospheric particles using different advection schemes based on vertical velocity formulations (omega or zetadot). The advection is performed over a number of integration nodes, using meteorological data interpolated in time and space.

Parameters
[in]ctlPointer to the control structure containing configuration settings.
[in]cachePointer to the cache structure storing precomputed time step values.
[in]met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the initial time.
[in]met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the next time step.
[in,out]atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle states.
  • If ctl->advect_vert_coord is 0 or 2, the function uses omega vertical velocity.
  • If ctl->advect_vert_coord is 1, the function uses zetadot vertical velocity.
  • The function interpolates meteorological data either on pressure levels or model levels.
  • The advection scheme supports different integration methods (e.g., two-stage, four-stage).
  • The function updates longitude, latitude, and pressure (or zeta) for each particle.
  • Special handling is applied to ensure zeta values remain non-negative.
Author
Lars Hoffmann
Jan Clemens

Definition at line 3017 of file mptrac.c.

3022 {
3023
3024 /* Set timer... */
3025 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_ADVECT", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3026
3027 /* Use omega vertical velocity... */
3028 if (ctl->advect_vert_coord == 0 || ctl->advect_vert_coord == 2) {
3029
3030 /* Loop over particles... */
3031 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1, "acc data present(ctl,cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
3032
3033 /* Init... */
3034 INTPOL_INIT;
3035 double dts, u[4], um = 0, v[4], vm = 0, w[4], wm = 0,
3036 x[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };
3037
3038 /* Loop over integration nodes... */
3039 for (int i = 0; i < ctl->advect; i++) {
3040
3041 /* Set position... */
3042 if (i == 0) {
3043 dts = 0.0;
3044 x[0] = atm->lon[ip];
3045 x[1] = atm->lat[ip];
3046 x[2] = atm->p[ip];
3047 } else {
3048 dts = (i == 3 ? 1.0 : 0.5) * cache->dt[ip];
3049 x[0] = atm->lon[ip] + DX2DEG(dts * u[i - 1] / 1000., atm->lat[ip]);
3050 x[1] = atm->lat[ip] + DY2DEG(dts * v[i - 1] / 1000.);
3051 x[2] = atm->p[ip] + dts * w[i - 1];
3052 }
3053 const double tm = atm->time[ip] + dts;
3054
3055 /* Interpolate meteo data on pressure levels... */
3056 if (ctl->advect_vert_coord == 0) {
3057 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->u, met1, met1->u,
3058 tm, x[2], x[0], x[1], &u[i], ci, cw, 1);
3059 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->v, met1, met1->v,
3060 tm, x[2], x[0], x[1], &v[i], ci, cw, 0);
3061 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->w, met1, met1->w,
3062 tm, x[2], x[0], x[1], &w[i], ci, cw, 0);
3063 }
3064
3065 /* Interpolate meteo data on model levels... */
3066 else {
3067 intpol_met_time_3d_ml(met0, met0->pl, met0->ul,
3068 met1, met1->pl, met1->ul,
3069 tm, x[2], x[0], x[1], &u[i]);
3070 intpol_met_time_3d_ml(met0, met0->pl, met0->vl,
3071 met1, met1->pl, met1->vl,
3072 tm, x[2], x[0], x[1], &v[i]);
3073 intpol_met_time_3d_ml(met0, met0->pl, met0->wl,
3074 met1, met1->pl, met1->wl,
3075 tm, x[2], x[0], x[1], &w[i]);
3076 }
3077
3078 /* Get mean wind... */
3079 double k = 1.0;
3080 if (ctl->advect == 2)
3081 k = (i == 0 ? 0.0 : 1.0);
3082 else if (ctl->advect == 4)
3083 k = (i == 0 || i == 3 ? 1.0 / 6.0 : 2.0 / 6.0);
3084 um += k * u[i];
3085 vm += k * v[i];
3086 wm += k * w[i];
3087 }
3088
3089 /* Set new position... */
3090 atm->time[ip] += cache->dt[ip];
3091 atm->lon[ip] += DX2DEG(cache->dt[ip] * um / 1000.,
3092 (ctl->advect == 2 ? x[1] : atm->lat[ip]));
3093 atm->lat[ip] += DY2DEG(cache->dt[ip] * vm / 1000.);
3094 atm->p[ip] += cache->dt[ip] * wm;
3095 }
3096 }
3097
3098 /* Use zetadot vertical velocity... */
3099 else if (ctl->advect_vert_coord == 1) {
3100
3101 /* Loop over particles... */
3102 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1, "acc data present(ctl,cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
3103
3104 /* Convert pressure to zeta... */
3105 INTPOL_INIT;
3106 intpol_met_4d_coord(met0, met0->pl, met0->zetal, met1,
3107 met1->pl, met1->zetal, atm->time[ip], atm->p[ip],
3108 atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip],
3109 &atm->q[ctl->qnt_zeta][ip], ci, cw, 1);
3110
3111 /* Init... */
3112 double dts, u[4], um = 0, v[4], vm = 0, zeta_dot[4],
3113 zeta_dotm = 0, x[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };
3114
3115 /* Loop over integration nodes... */
3116 for (int i = 0; i < ctl->advect; i++) {
3117
3118 /* Set position... */
3119 if (i == 0) {
3120 dts = 0.0;
3121 x[0] = atm->lon[ip];
3122 x[1] = atm->lat[ip];
3123 x[2] = atm->q[ctl->qnt_zeta][ip];
3124 } else {
3125 dts = (i == 3 ? 1.0 : 0.5) * cache->dt[ip];
3126 x[0] = atm->lon[ip] + DX2DEG(dts * u[i - 1] / 1000., atm->lat[ip]);
3127 x[1] = atm->lat[ip] + DY2DEG(dts * v[i - 1] / 1000.);
3128 x[2] = atm->q[ctl->qnt_zeta][ip] + dts * zeta_dot[i - 1];
3129 }
3130 const double tm = atm->time[ip] + dts;
3131
3132 /* Interpolate meteo data... */
3133 intpol_met_4d_coord(met0, met0->zetal, met0->ul, met1, met1->zetal,
3134 met1->ul, tm, x[2], x[0], x[1], &u[i], ci, cw, 1);
3135 intpol_met_4d_coord(met0, met0->zetal, met0->vl, met1, met1->zetal,
3136 met1->vl, tm, x[2], x[0], x[1], &v[i], ci, cw, 0);
3137 intpol_met_4d_coord(met0, met0->zetal, met0->zeta_dotl, met1,
3138 met1->zetal, met1->zeta_dotl, tm, x[2], x[0],
3139 x[1], &zeta_dot[i], ci, cw, 0);
3140
3141 /* Get mean wind... */
3142 double k = 1.0;
3143 if (ctl->advect == 2)
3144 k = (i == 0 ? 0.0 : 1.0);
3145 else if (ctl->advect == 4)
3146 k = (i == 0 || i == 3 ? 1.0 / 6.0 : 2.0 / 6.0);
3147 um += k * u[i];
3148 vm += k * v[i];
3149 zeta_dotm += k * zeta_dot[i];
3150 }
3151
3152 /* Set new position... */
3153 atm->time[ip] += cache->dt[ip];
3154 atm->lon[ip] += DX2DEG(cache->dt[ip] * um / 1000.,
3155 (ctl->advect == 2 ? x[1] : atm->lat[ip]));
3156 atm->lat[ip] += DY2DEG(cache->dt[ip] * vm / 1000.);
3157 atm->q[ctl->qnt_zeta][ip] += cache->dt[ip] * zeta_dotm;
3158
3159 /* Convert zeta to pressure... */
3160 intpol_met_4d_coord(met0, met0->zetal, met0->pl, met1, met1->zetal,
3161 met1->pl, atm->time[ip],
3162 atm->q[ctl->qnt_zeta][ip], atm->lon[ip],
3163 atm->lat[ip], &atm->p[ip], ci, cw, 1);
3164 }
3165 }
3166}

◆ module_advect_init()

void module_advect_init ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Initializes the advection module by setting up pressure fields.

This function initializes the advection module, setting up the air parcel pressure to be consistent with the given zeta vertical coordinate. It utilizes meteorological data from two time steps and interpolates the pressure values accordingly.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing configuration flags.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
met0Pointer to the initial meteorological data structure.
met1Pointer to the final meteorological data structure.
atmPointer to the air parcel data structure.

The function performs the following operations:

  • Sets up a timer labeled "MODULE_ADVECT_INIT" within the "PHYSICS" category.
  • If the zeta vertical coordinate system is specified (ctl->vert_coord_ap == 1), it initializes the pressure fields to be consistent with the zeta coordinate using 4D interpolation.
Author
Jan Clemens

Definition at line 3170 of file mptrac.c.

3175 {
3176
3177 /* Check parameters... */
3178 if (ctl->advect_vert_coord != 1)
3179 return;
3180
3181 /* Set timer... */
3182 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_ADVECT_INIT", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3183
3184 /* Loop over particles... */
3185 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 0, "acc data present(ctl,met0,met1,atm)") {
3186
3187 /* Initialize pressure consistent with zeta... */
3188 INTPOL_INIT;
3189 intpol_met_4d_coord(met0, met0->zetal, met0->pl, met1, met1->zetal,
3190 met1->pl, atm->time[ip], atm->q[ctl->qnt_zeta][ip],
3191 atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip], &atm->p[ip], ci, cw, 1);
3192 }
3193}
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_bound_cond()

void module_bound_cond ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
const clim_t *  clim,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Apply boundary conditions to particles based on meteorological and climatological data.

This function applies boundary conditions to particles based on specified criteria, including latitude, pressure, surface layer parameters, and climatological data. It loops over each particle and checks whether it satisfies the specified boundary conditions. If a particle satisfies the conditions, its properties such as mass, volume mixing ratio, and age of air are updated accordingly.

It checks for quantity flags to determine which properties need to be updated. If the latitude or pressure of a particle falls outside the specified ranges, it skips the particle. It also considers surface layer parameters such as surface pressure, height, zeta range, and planetary boundary layer. If a particle is within the specified surface layer boundaries, its properties are updated accordingly.

The function updates properties such as mass and volume mixing ratio if the corresponding flags are set. It retrieves volume mixing ratio values for various trace gases (e.g., CFC-10, CFC-11, N2O, SF6) from climatological time series data and updates the particle properties accordingly. Additionally, it updates the age of air for each particle based on the current simulation time.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
climPointer to the climatological data structure containing time series data.
met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the initial time step.
met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the next time step.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
Author
Lars Hoffmann
Mingzhao Liu

Definition at line 3197 of file mptrac.c.

3203 {
3204
3205 /* Set timer... */
3206 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_BOUND_COND", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3207
3208 /* Check quantity flags... */
3209 if (ctl->qnt_m < 0 && ctl->qnt_vmr < 0 && ctl->qnt_Cccl4
3210 && ctl->qnt_Cccl3f < 0 && ctl->qnt_Cccl2f2 < 0
3211 && ctl->qnt_Cn2o < 0 && ctl->qnt_Csf6 < 0 && ctl->qnt_aoa < 0)
3212 return;
3213
3214 /* Loop over particles... */
3215 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1,
3216 "acc data present(ctl,cache,clim,met0,met1,atm)") {
3217
3218 /* Check latitude and pressure range... */
3219 if (atm->lat[ip] < ctl->bound_lat0 || atm->lat[ip] > ctl->bound_lat1
3220 || atm->p[ip] > ctl->bound_p0 || atm->p[ip] < ctl->bound_p1)
3221 continue;
3222
3223 /* Check surface layer... */
3224 if (ctl->bound_dps > 0 || ctl->bound_dzs > 0
3225 || ctl->bound_zetas > 0 || ctl->bound_pbl) {
3226
3227 /* Get surface pressure... */
3228 double ps;
3229 INTPOL_INIT;
3230 INTPOL_2D(ps, 1);
3231
3232 /* Check pressure... */
3233 if (ctl->bound_dps > 0 && atm->p[ip] < ps - ctl->bound_dps)
3234 continue;
3235
3236 /* Check height... */
3237 if (ctl->bound_dzs > 0 && Z(atm->p[ip]) > Z(ps) + ctl->bound_dzs)
3238 continue;
3239
3240 /* Check zeta range... */
3241 if (ctl->bound_zetas > 0) {
3242 double t;
3243 INTPOL_3D(t, 1);
3244 if (ZETA(ps, atm->p[ip], t) > ctl->bound_zetas)
3245 continue;
3246 }
3247
3248 /* Check planetary boundary layer... */
3249 if (ctl->bound_pbl) {
3250 double pbl;
3251 INTPOL_2D(pbl, 0);
3252 if (atm->p[ip] < pbl)
3253 continue;
3254 }
3255 }
3256
3257 /* Set mass and volume mixing ratio... */
3258 if (ctl->qnt_m >= 0 && ctl->bound_mass >= 0)
3259 atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] =
3260 ctl->bound_mass + ctl->bound_mass_trend * atm->time[ip];
3261 if (ctl->qnt_vmr >= 0 && ctl->bound_vmr >= 0)
3262 atm->q[ctl->qnt_vmr][ip] =
3263 ctl->bound_vmr + ctl->bound_vmr_trend * atm->time[ip];
3264
3265 /* Set CFC-10 volume mixing ratio... */
3266 if (ctl->qnt_Cccl4 >= 0 && ctl->clim_ccl4_timeseries[0] != '-')
3267 atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cccl4][ip] = clim_ts(&clim->ccl4, atm->time[ip]);
3268
3269 /* Set CFC-11 volume mixing ratio... */
3270 if (ctl->qnt_Cccl3f >= 0 && ctl->clim_ccl3f_timeseries[0] != '-')
3271 atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cccl3f][ip] = clim_ts(&clim->ccl3f, atm->time[ip]);
3272
3273 /* Set CFC-12 volume mixing ratio... */
3274 if (ctl->qnt_Cccl2f2 >= 0 && ctl->clim_ccl2f2_timeseries[0] != '-')
3275 atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cccl2f2][ip] = clim_ts(&clim->ccl2f2, atm->time[ip]);
3276
3277 /* Set N2O volume mixing ratio... */
3278 if (ctl->qnt_Cn2o >= 0 && ctl->clim_n2o_timeseries[0] != '-')
3279 atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cn2o][ip] = clim_ts(&clim->n2o, atm->time[ip]);
3280
3281 /* Set SF6 volume mixing ratio... */
3282 if (ctl->qnt_Csf6 >= 0 && ctl->clim_sf6_timeseries[0] != '-')
3283 atm->q[ctl->qnt_Csf6][ip] = clim_ts(&clim->sf6, atm->time[ip]);
3284
3285 /* Set age of air... */
3286 if (ctl->qnt_aoa >= 0)
3287 atm->q[ctl->qnt_aoa][ip] = atm->time[ip];
3288 }
3289}

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_chem_grid()

void module_chem_grid ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm,
const double  t 
)

Computes gridded chemical tracer concentrations (volume mixing ratio) from individual air parcel mass data and assigns them back to the parcels.

This function aggregates the mass of tracer particles onto a 3D chemical grid (longitude × latitude × altitude), accounting for either single or ensemble simulations depending on ctl->nens. It then interpolates meteorological temperature fields and computes volume mixing ratios, storing them in the specified tracer quantity (e.g., ctl->qnt_Cx).

If the molar mass is undefined or required quantity indices are missing, the function exits early.

Parallelization is supported via OpenMP or OpenACC.

Parameters
[in]ctlPointer to the control structure containing configuration parameters, including grid dimensions, tracer indices, and simulation mode.
[in]met0Pointer to the meteorological data at the beginning of the interpolation interval.
[in]met1Pointer to the meteorological data at the end of the interpolation interval.
[in,out]atmPointer to the atmospheric state, including parcel coordinates, time, mass, and output tracer fields.
[in]tCentral time step used for output and interpolation.
Note
  • Requires ctl->molmass > 0, and ctl->qnt_m and ctl->qnt_Cx to be set.
  • Uses ensemble mode if ctl->nens > 0 and assigns each parcel to its ensemble member via ctl->qnt_ens.
  • Grid box volume mixing ratios are computed assuming ideal gas law and a layered spherical grid.
  • The output quantity (e.g., qnt_Cx) is given in ppbv.
See also
intpol_met_time_3d()
P(), Z(), RHO()
ARRAY_3D macro
Author
Mingzhao Liu
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 3293 of file mptrac.c.

3298 {
3299
3300 /* Check quantities... */
3301 if (ctl->qnt_m < 0 || ctl->qnt_Cx < 0)
3302 return;
3303 if (ctl->molmass <= 0)
3304 ERRMSG("Molar mass is not defined!");
3305
3306 /* Set timer... */
3307 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_CHEM_GRID", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3308
3309 /* Allocate... */
3310 const int ensemble_mode = (ctl->nens > 0);
3311 const int np = atm->np;
3312 const int nz = ctl->chemgrid_nz;
3313 const int nx = ctl->chemgrid_nx;
3314 const int ny = ctl->chemgrid_ny;
3315 const int ngrid = nx * ny * nz;
3316 const int nens = ensemble_mode ? ctl->nens : 1;
3317
3318 double *restrict const z = (double *) malloc((size_t) nz * sizeof(double));
3319 double *restrict const press =
3320 (double *) malloc((size_t) nz * sizeof(double));
3321 double *restrict const mass =
3322 (double *) calloc((size_t) ngrid * (size_t) nens, sizeof(double));
3323 double *restrict const area =
3324 (double *) malloc((size_t) ny * sizeof(double));
3325 double *restrict const lon =
3326 (double *) malloc((size_t) nx * sizeof(double));
3327 double *restrict const lat =
3328 (double *) malloc((size_t) ny * sizeof(double));
3329
3330 int *restrict const ixs = (int *) malloc((size_t) np * sizeof(int));
3331 int *restrict const iys = (int *) malloc((size_t) np * sizeof(int));
3332 int *restrict const izs = (int *) malloc((size_t) np * sizeof(int));
3333
3334 /* Set grid box size... */
3335 const double dz = (ctl->chemgrid_z1 - ctl->chemgrid_z0) / nz;
3336 const double dlon = (ctl->chemgrid_lon1 - ctl->chemgrid_lon0) / nx;
3337 const double dlat = (ctl->chemgrid_lat1 - ctl->chemgrid_lat0) / ny;
3338
3339 /* Set vertical coordinates... */
3340#ifdef _OPENACC
3341#pragma acc enter data create(ixs[0:np],iys[0:np],izs[0:np],z[0:nz],press[0:nz],mass[0:ngrid*nens],area[0:ny],lon[0:nx],lat[0:ny])
3342#pragma acc data present(ctl,met0,met1,atm,ixs,iys,izs,z,press,mass,area,lon,lat)
3343#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
3344#else
3345#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
3346#endif
3347 for (int iz = 0; iz < nz; iz++) {
3348 z[iz] = ctl->chemgrid_z0 + dz * (iz + 0.5);
3349 press[iz] = P(z[iz]);
3350 }
3351
3352 /* Set time interval for output... */
3353 const double t0 = tt - 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
3354 const double t1 = tt + 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
3355
3356 /* Get indices... */
3357#ifdef _OPENACC
3358#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
3359#else
3360#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
3361#endif
3362 for (int ip = 0; ip < np; ip++) {
3363 ixs[ip] = (int) ((atm->lon[ip] - ctl->chemgrid_lon0) / dlon);
3364 iys[ip] = (int) ((atm->lat[ip] - ctl->chemgrid_lat0) / dlat);
3365 izs[ip] = (int) ((Z(atm->p[ip]) - ctl->chemgrid_z0) / dz);
3366 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1
3367 || ixs[ip] < 0 || ixs[ip] >= nx
3368 || iys[ip] < 0 || iys[ip] >= ny || izs[ip] < 0 || izs[ip] >= nz)
3369 izs[ip] = -1;
3370 }
3371
3372 /* Set horizontal coordinates... */
3373#ifdef _OPENACC
3374#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
3375#else
3376#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
3377#endif
3378 for (int ix = 0; ix < nx; ix++)
3379 lon[ix] = ctl->chemgrid_lon0 + dlon * (ix + 0.5);
3380
3381#ifdef _OPENACC
3382#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
3383#else
3384#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
3385#endif
3386 for (int iy = 0; iy < ny; iy++) {
3387 lat[iy] = ctl->chemgrid_lat0 + dlat * (iy + 0.5);
3388 area[iy] = dlat * dlon * SQR(RE * M_PI / 180.) * cos(DEG2RAD(lat[iy]));
3389 }
3390
3391 /* Get mass per grid box... */
3392#ifdef _OPENACC
3393#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
3394#endif
3395 for (int ip = 0; ip < np; ip++) {
3396 if (izs[ip] >= 0) {
3397 int mass_idx = ARRAY_3D(ixs[ip], iys[ip], ny, izs[ip], nz);
3398 if (ensemble_mode) {
3399 const int ens = (int) atm->q[ctl->qnt_ens][ip];
3400 mass_idx += ens * ngrid;
3401 }
3402#ifdef _OPENACC
3403#pragma acc atomic update
3404#endif
3405 mass[mass_idx] += atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip];
3406 }
3407 }
3408
3409 /* Assign grid data to air parcels ... */
3410#ifdef _OPENACC
3411#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
3412#else
3413#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
3414#endif
3415 for (int ip = 0; ip < np; ip++)
3416 if (izs[ip] >= 0) {
3417
3418 /* Interpolate temperature... */
3419 double temp;
3420 INTPOL_INIT;
3421 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->t, met1, met1->t, tt,
3422 press[izs[ip]],
3423 lon[ixs[ip]], lat[iys[ip]], &temp, ci, cw, 1);
3424
3425 /* Set mass... */
3426 int mass_idx = ARRAY_3D(ixs[ip], iys[ip], ny, izs[ip], nz);
3427 if (ensemble_mode) {
3428 const int ens = (int) atm->q[ctl->qnt_ens][ip];
3429 mass_idx += ens * ngrid;
3430 }
3431
3432 /* Calculate volume mixing ratio... */
3433 const double m = mass[mass_idx];
3434 atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cx][ip] = MA / ctl->molmass * m
3435 / (RHO(press[izs[ip]], temp) * area[iys[ip]] * dz * 1e9);
3436 }
3437
3438 /* Free... */
3439#ifdef _OPENACC
3440#pragma acc exit data delete(ixs,iys,izs,z,press,mass,area,lon,lat)
3441#endif
3442 free(mass);
3443 free(lon);
3444 free(lat);
3445 free(area);
3446 free(z);
3447 free(press);
3448 free(ixs);
3449 free(iys);
3450 free(izs);
3451}

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_chem_init()

void module_chem_init ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
const clim_t *  clim,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Initializes the chemistry modules by setting atmospheric composition.

This function initializes various chemical components of the atmosphere using meteorological data and climatological information. It interpolates and sets values for water vapor (H2O), ozone (O3), and several radical species such as OH, HO2, H2O2, and O1D for each air parcel.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing quantity flags.
climPointer to the climatology structure containing climatological data.
met0Pointer to the initial meteorological data structure.
met1Pointer to the final meteorological data structure.
atmPointer to the air parcel data structure.

The function uses OpenMP for parallel processing, iterating over each point in the atmosphere (atm->np) to initialize chemical species concentrations. It performs the following steps:

  • Interpolates H2O and O3 data from meteorological input if the respective quantity flags (ctl->qnt_Ch2o and ctl->qnt_Co3) are set.
  • Sets the concentrations of OH, HO2, H2O2, and O1D using climatological data if the respective quantity flags are set.
Author
Mingzhao Liu

Definition at line 3455 of file mptrac.c.

3461 {
3462
3463 /* Set timer... */
3464 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_CHEM_INIT", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3465
3466 /* Loop over particles... */
3467 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 0,
3468 "acc data present(ctl,cache,clim,met0,met1,atm)") {
3469
3470 /* Set H2O and O3 using meteo data... */
3471 INTPOL_INIT;
3472 if (ctl->qnt_Ch2o >= 0) {
3473 double h2o;
3474 INTPOL_3D(h2o, 1);
3475 SET_ATM(qnt_Ch2o, h2o);
3476 }
3477 if (ctl->qnt_Co3 >= 0) {
3478 double o3;
3479 INTPOL_3D(o3, 1);
3480 SET_ATM(qnt_Co3, o3);
3481 }
3482
3483 /* Set radical species... */
3484 SET_ATM(qnt_Coh, clim_oh(ctl, clim, atm->time[ip],
3485 atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip], atm->p[ip]));
3486 SET_ATM(qnt_Cho2, clim_zm(&clim->ho2, atm->time[ip],
3487 atm->lat[ip], atm->p[ip]));
3488 SET_ATM(qnt_Ch2o2, clim_zm(&clim->h2o2, atm->time[ip],
3489 atm->lat[ip], atm->p[ip]));
3490 SET_ATM(qnt_Co1d, clim_zm(&clim->o1d, atm->time[ip],
3491 atm->lat[ip], atm->p[ip]));
3492 }

◆ module_convection()

void module_convection ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
cache_t *  cache,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Performs convective mixing of atmospheric particles.

This function adjusts the pressure of atmospheric particles based on boundary layer (PBL) mixing and convective conditions driven by CAPE (Convective Available Potential Energy) and CIN (Convective Inhibition). It uses meteorological data and random numbers for vertical mixing calculations.

Parameters
[in]ctlPointer to the control structure with simulation settings.
[in,out]cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
[in,out]met0Pointer to the meteorological data at the initial timestep.
[in,out]met1Pointer to the meteorological data at the subsequent timestep.
[in,out]atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure with particle properties.
Note
  • This function modifies the atm structure in place.
  • Interpolates CAPE, CIN, and other meteorological parameters.
  • Determines the pressure range for PBL and convective mixing.
  • Updates the pressure of particles based on calculated mixing.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 3497 of file mptrac.c.

3502 {
3503
3504 /* Set timer... */
3505 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_CONVECTION", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3506
3507 /* Create random numbers... */
3508 module_rng(ctl, cache->rs, (size_t) atm->np, 0);
3509
3510 /* Loop over particles... */
3511 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1, "acc data present(ctl,cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
3512
3513 /* Interpolate surface pressure... */
3514 double ps;
3515 INTPOL_INIT;
3516 INTPOL_2D(ps, 1);
3517
3518 /* Initialize pressure range for vertical mixing... */
3519 double pbot = ps, ptop = ps;
3520
3521 /* Mixing in the PBL... */
3522 if (ctl->conv_mix_pbl) {
3523
3524 /* Interpolate PBL... */
3525 double pbl;
3526 INTPOL_2D(pbl, 0);
3527
3528 /* Set pressure range... */
3529 ptop = pbl - ctl->conv_pbl_trans * (ps - pbl);
3530 }
3531
3532 /* Convective mixing... */
3533 if (ctl->conv_cape >= 0) {
3534
3535 /* Interpolate CAPE, CIN, and equilibrium level... */
3536 double cape, cin, pel;
3537 INTPOL_2D(cape, 0);
3538 INTPOL_2D(cin, 0);
3539 INTPOL_2D(pel, 0);
3540
3541 /* Set pressure range... */
3542 if (isfinite(cape) && cape >= ctl->conv_cape
3543 && (ctl->conv_cin <= 0 || (isfinite(cin) && cin >= ctl->conv_cin)))
3544 ptop = GSL_MIN(ptop, pel);
3545 }
3546
3547 /* Apply vertical mixing... */
3548 if (ptop != pbot && atm->p[ip] >= ptop) {
3549
3550 /* Get density range... */
3551 double tbot, ttop;
3552 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->t, met1, met1->t, atm->time[ip],
3553 pbot, atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip], &tbot, ci, cw, 1);
3554 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->t, met1, met1->t, atm->time[ip], ptop,
3555 atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip], &ttop, ci, cw, 1);
3556 const double rhobot = pbot / tbot;
3557 const double rhotop = ptop / ttop;
3558
3559 /* Get new density... */
3560 const double rho = rhobot + (rhotop - rhobot) * cache->rs[ip];
3561
3562 /* Get pressure... */
3563 atm->p[ip] = LIN(rhobot, pbot, rhotop, ptop, rho);
3564 }
3565 }
3566}

void module_rng(const ctl_t *ctl, double *rs, const size_t n, const int method)
Generate random numbers using various methods and distributions.

Random numbers.

Depth of PBL transition layer (fraction of PBL depth).

Vertical mixing in the PBL (0=off, 1=on).

◆ module_decay()

void module_decay ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
const clim_t *  clim,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Simulate exponential decay processes for atmospheric particles.

This function simulates decay processes for atmospheric particles based on their mass or volume mixing ratio. It loops over each particle and calculates the decay rate using weighting factors for tropospheric and stratospheric lifetimes. Exponential decay is then calculated, and the mass or volume mixing ratio of particles is updated accordingly. Loss rates can also be calculated and updated based on the decay process.

The function checks for quantity flags to ensure that mass or volume mixing ratio data is available. It then calculates the weighting factor based on the particle's location in the atmosphere and sets the lifetime accordingly. Exponential decay is calculated using the time step and the lifetime, and the particle's mass or volume mixing ratio is updated. Loss rates can also be updated based on the decay process.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
climPointer to the climate data structure containing atmospheric data.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 3610 of file mptrac.c.

3614 {
3615
3616 /* Set timer... */
3617 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_DECAY", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3618
3619 /* Check quantity flags... */
3620 if (ctl->qnt_m < 0 && ctl->qnt_vmr < 0)
3621 ERRMSG("Module needs quantity mass or volume mixing ratio!");
3622
3623 /* Loop over particles... */
3624 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1, "acc data present(ctl,cache,clim,atm)") {
3625
3626 /* Get weighting factor... */
3627 const double w = tropo_weight(clim, atm, ip);
3628
3629 /* Set lifetime... */
3630 const double tdec = w * ctl->tdec_trop + (1 - w) * ctl->tdec_strat;
3631
3632 /* Calculate exponential decay... */
3633 const double aux = exp(-cache->dt[ip] / tdec);
3634 if (ctl->qnt_m >= 0) {
3635 if (ctl->qnt_mloss_decay >= 0)
3636 atm->q[ctl->qnt_mloss_decay][ip]
3637 += atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] * (1 - aux);
3638 atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] *= aux;
3639 if (ctl->qnt_loss_rate >= 0)
3640 atm->q[ctl->qnt_loss_rate][ip] += 1. / tdec;
3641 }
3642 if (ctl->qnt_vmr >= 0)
3643 atm->q[ctl->qnt_vmr][ip] *= aux;
3644 }
3645}
tropo_weight
double tropo_weight(const clim_t *clim, const atm_t *atm, const int ip)
Computes a weighting factor based on tropopause pressure.
Definition: mptrac.c:11303
ctl_t::qnt_loss_rate
int qnt_loss_rate
Quantity array index for total loss rate.
Definition: mptrac.h:2432
ctl_t::qnt_mloss_decay
int qnt_mloss_decay
Quantity array index for total mass loss due to exponential decay.
Definition: mptrac.h:2429
ctl_t::tdec_strat
double tdec_strat
Life time of particles in the stratosphere [s].
Definition: mptrac.h:2842
ctl_t::tdec_trop
double tdec_trop
Life time of particles in the troposphere [s].
Definition: mptrac.h:2839
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_diff_meso()

void module_diff_meso ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
cache_t *  cache,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Simulate mesoscale diffusion for atmospheric particles.

This function simulates mesoscale diffusion for atmospheric particles, including horizontal and vertical wind fluctuations. It calculates standard deviations of local wind data and temporal correlations for mesoscale fluctuations. Mesoscale wind fluctuations are then calculated based on the provided random numbers and turbulence parameters. The particle positions are updated accordingly.

The function loops over each particle and calculates indices for interpolation of wind data. It then computes standard deviations of local wind data and temporal correlations for mesoscale fluctuations. Based on the turbulence parameters and provided random numbers, it calculates horizontal and vertical mesoscale wind fluctuations. Finally, it updates the particle positions based on the calculated wind fluctuations.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the current time step.
met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the next time step.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
Note
Control parameters TURB_MESOX and TURB_MESOZ define the subgrid-scale variability as a fraction of the grid-scale variance. Stohl et al. (2005) recommend a default value of 0.16 for both parameters, providing a standard approach for turbulence representation. However, recent findings by Bakels et al. (2024) suggest disabling this approach to improve model accuracy under certain conditions. It is advised to evaluate the applicability of these recommendations based on the specific simulation context and objectives.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 3649 of file mptrac.c.

3654 {
3655
3656 /* Set timer... */
3657 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_DIFF_MESO", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3658
3659 /* Create random numbers... */
3660 module_rng(ctl, cache->rs, 3 * (size_t) atm->np, 1);
3661
3662 /* Loop over particles... */
3663 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1, "acc data present(ctl,cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
3664
3665 /* Get indices... */
3666 const int ix = locate_reg(met0->lon, met0->nx, atm->lon[ip]);
3667 const int iy = locate_irr(met0->lat, met0->ny, atm->lat[ip]);
3668 const int iz = locate_irr(met0->p, met0->np, atm->p[ip]);
3669
3670 /* Get standard deviations of local wind data... */
3671 float umean = 0, usig = 0, vmean = 0, vsig = 0, wmean = 0, wsig = 0;
3672 for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++)
3673 for (int j = 0; j < 2; j++)
3674 for (int k = 0; k < 2; k++) {
3675 umean += met0->u[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k];
3676 usig += SQR(met0->u[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k]);
3677 vmean += met0->v[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k];
3678 vsig += SQR(met0->v[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k]);
3679 wmean += met0->w[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k];
3680 wsig += SQR(met0->w[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k]);
3681
3682 umean += met1->u[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k];
3683 usig += SQR(met1->u[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k]);
3684 vmean += met1->v[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k];
3685 vsig += SQR(met1->v[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k]);
3686 wmean += met1->w[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k];
3687 wsig += SQR(met1->w[ix + i][iy + j][iz + k]);
3688 }
3689 usig = usig / 16.f - SQR(umean / 16.f);
3690 usig = (usig > 0 ? sqrtf(usig) : 0);
3691 vsig = vsig / 16.f - SQR(vmean / 16.f);
3692 vsig = (vsig > 0 ? sqrtf(vsig) : 0);
3693 wsig = wsig / 16.f - SQR(wmean / 16.f);
3694 wsig = (wsig > 0 ? sqrtf(wsig) : 0);
3695
3696 /* Set temporal correlations for mesoscale fluctuations... */
3697 const double r = 1 - 2 * fabs(cache->dt[ip]) / ctl->dt_met;
3698 const double r2 = sqrt(1 - r * r);
3699
3700 /* Calculate horizontal mesoscale wind fluctuations... */
3701 if (ctl->turb_mesox > 0) {
3702 cache->uvwp[ip][0] =
3703 (float) (r * cache->uvwp[ip][0] +
3704 r2 * cache->rs[3 * ip] * ctl->turb_mesox * usig);
3705 atm->lon[ip] +=
3706 DX2DEG(cache->uvwp[ip][0] * cache->dt[ip] / 1000., atm->lat[ip]);
3707
3708 cache->uvwp[ip][1] =
3709 (float) (r * cache->uvwp[ip][1] +
3710 r2 * cache->rs[3 * ip + 1] * ctl->turb_mesox * vsig);
3711 atm->lat[ip] += DY2DEG(cache->uvwp[ip][1] * cache->dt[ip] / 1000.);
3712 }
3713
3714 /* Calculate vertical mesoscale wind fluctuations... */
3715 if (ctl->turb_mesoz > 0) {
3716 cache->uvwp[ip][2] =
3717 (float) (r * cache->uvwp[ip][2] +
3718 r2 * cache->rs[3 * ip + 2] * ctl->turb_mesoz * wsig);
3719 atm->p[ip] += cache->uvwp[ip][2] * cache->dt[ip];
3720 }
3721 }
3722}
cache_t::uvwp
float uvwp[NP][3]
Wind perturbations [m/s].

double turb_mesoz
Vertical scaling factor for mesoscale wind fluctuations.

ctl_t::dt_met
double dt_met

double turb_mesox

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_diff_pbl()

void module_diff_pbl ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
cache_t *  cache,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Computes particle diffusion within the planetary boundary layer (PBL).

This function handles the effects of turbulence on particles within the PBL. It calculates turbulent velocity variances, Lagrangian timescales, and updates particle positions and perturbations based on random fluctuations and boundary layer physics. This module adapts the approach of Ryall and Maryon (1998) and Stohl et al. (2005).

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing model settings.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure for the current timestep.
met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure for the next timestep.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle states.

The function:

  • Allocates memory for random numbers and generates them using module_rng.
  • Loops over all particles to compute their behavior within the boundary layer.
  • Handles both stable/neutral and unstable conditions based on the surface sensible heat flux.
  • Calculates turbulent velocity variances (sig_u, sig_w), their vertical derivatives, and Lagrangian timescales (tau_u, tau_w).
  • Updates particle velocity perturbations and positions using turbulent diffusion equations.

The function uses OpenACC directives for GPU acceleration.

Note
The function handles edge cases like zero diffusivity and imposes minimum limits on calculated values to ensure stability.
Warning
Ensure that all input pointers are properly initialized and accessible before calling this function.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 3726 of file mptrac.c.

3731 {
3732
3733 /* Set timer... */
3734 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_DIFF_PBL", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3735
3736 /* Create random numbers... */
3737 module_rng(ctl, cache->rs, 3 * (size_t) atm->np, 1);
3738
3739 /* Loop over particles... */
3740 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1, "acc data present(ctl,cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
3741
3742 double dsigw_dz = 0.0, sig_u = 0.25, sig_w = 0.1,
3743 tau_u = 300., tau_w = 100.;
3744
3745 /* Get surface and PBL pressure... */
3746 double pbl, ps;
3747 INTPOL_INIT;
3748 INTPOL_2D(ps, 1);
3749 INTPOL_2D(pbl, 0);
3750
3751 /* Boundary layer... */
3752 if (atm->p[ip] >= pbl) {
3753
3754 /* Calculate heights... */
3755 const double p = MIN(atm->p[ip], ps);
3756 const double zs = Z(ps);
3757 const double z = 1e3 * (Z(p) - zs);
3758 const double zi = 1e3 * (Z(pbl) - zs);
3759 const double zratio = z / zi;
3760
3761 /* Calculate friction velocity... */
3762 double ess, nss, h2o, t;
3763 INTPOL_2D(ess, 0);
3764 INTPOL_2D(nss, 0);
3765 INTPOL_3D(t, 1);
3766 INTPOL_3D(h2o, 0);
3767 const double rho = RHO(p, TVIRT(t, h2o));
3768 const double tau = sqrt(SQR(ess) + SQR(nss));
3769 const double ustar = sqrt(tau / rho);
3770
3771 /* Get surface sensible heat flux... */
3772 double shf;
3773 INTPOL_2D(shf, 1);
3774
3775 /* Stable or neutral conditions... */
3776 if (shf <= 0) {
3777
3778 /* Calcalute turbulent velocity variances... */
3779 sig_u = 1e-2 + 2.0 * ustar * (1.0 - zratio);
3780 sig_w = 1e-2 + 1.3 * ustar * (1.0 - zratio);
3781
3782 /* Calculate derivative dsig_w/dz... */
3783 dsigw_dz = -1.3 * ustar / zi;
3784
3785 /* Calcalute Lagrangian timescales... */
3786 tau_u = 0.07 * zi / sig_u * sqrt(zratio);
3787 tau_w = 0.1 * zi / sig_w * pow(zratio, 0.8);
3788 }
3789
3790 /* Unstable conditions... */
3791 else {
3792
3793 /* Convective velocity... */
3794 const double wstar =
3795 pow(G0 / THETAVIRT(p, t, h2o) * shf / (rho * CPD) * zi, 1. / 3.);
3796
3797 /* Calcalute turbulent velocity variances... */
3798 sig_u = 1e-2
3799 + sqrt(0.4 * SQR(wstar) + (5.0 - 4.0 * zratio) * SQR(ustar));
3800 sig_w = 1e-2 + sqrt(1.2 * SQR(wstar) * (1.0 - 0.9 * zratio)
3801 * pow(zratio, 2.0 / 3.0)
3802 + (1.8 - 1.4 * zratio) * SQR(ustar));
3803
3804 /* Calculate derivative dsig_w/dz... */
3805 dsigw_dz = 0.5 / sig_w / zi * (-1.4 * SQR(ustar) + SQR(wstar)
3806 * (0.8 *
3807 pow(MAX(zratio, 1e-3), -1.0 / 3.0)
3808 - 1.8 * pow(zratio, 2.0 / 3.0)));
3809
3810 /* Calculate Lagrangian timescales... */
3811 const double C0 = 3.0; // TODO: typically 3...6, NAME model uses 3?
3812 const double eps =
3813 (1.5 - 1.2 * pow(zratio, 1.0 / 3.0)) * SQR(wstar) * wstar / zi
3814 + SQR(ustar) * ustar * (1.0 - 0.8 * zratio) / (KARMAN * z);
3815 tau_u = 2 * SQR(sig_u) / (C0 * eps);
3816 tau_w = 2 * SQR(sig_w) / (C0 * eps);
3817 }
3818 }
3819
3820 /* Set minimum values... */
3821 sig_u = MAX(sig_u, 0.25);
3822 sig_w = MAX(sig_w, 0.1);
3823 tau_u = MAX(tau_u, 300.);
3824 tau_w = MAX(tau_w, 100.);
3825
3826 /* Update perturbations... */
3827 const double ru = exp(-fabs(cache->dt[ip]) / tau_u);
3828 const double ru2 = sqrt(1.0 - SQR(ru));
3829 cache->uvwp[ip][0]
3830 = (float) (cache->uvwp[ip][0] * ru + ru2 * cache->rs[3 * ip]);
3831 cache->uvwp[ip][1]
3832 = (float) (cache->uvwp[ip][1] * ru + ru2 * cache->rs[3 * ip + 1]);
3833
3834 const double rw = exp(-fabs(cache->dt[ip]) / tau_w);
3835 const double rw2 = sqrt(1.0 - SQR(rw));
3836 cache->uvwp[ip][2]
3837 = (float) (cache->uvwp[ip][2] * rw + rw2 * cache->rs[3 * ip + 2]
3838 + sig_w * dsigw_dz * cache->dt[ip]); // TODO: check approx for density correction?
3839
3840 /* Calculate new air parcel position... */
3841 atm->lon[ip] +=
3842 DX2DEG(cache->uvwp[ip][0] * cache->dt[ip] / 1000., atm->lat[ip]);
3843 atm->lat[ip] += DY2DEG(cache->uvwp[ip][1] * cache->dt[ip] / 1000.);
3844 atm->p[ip] +=
3845 DZ2DP(cache->uvwp[ip][2] * cache->dt[ip] / 1000., atm->p[ip]);
3846 }
3847}
TVIRT
#define TVIRT(t, h2o)
Compute virtual temperature.
Definition: mptrac.h:1836
KARMAN
#define KARMAN
Karman's constant.
Definition: mptrac.h:229
THETAVIRT
#define THETAVIRT(p, t, h2o)
Compute virtual potential temperature.
Definition: mptrac.h:1790
DZ2DP
#define DZ2DP(dz, p)
Convert a change in altitude to a change in pressure.
Definition: mptrac.h:629
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_diff_turb()

void module_diff_turb ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
cache_t *  cache,
const clim_t *  clim,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Applies turbulent diffusion processes to atmospheric particles.

This function calculates and applies turbulent diffusion effects, including horizontal and vertical diffusion, as well as vertical mixing in the planetary boundary layer (PBL), to a set of atmospheric particles based on input parameters and environmental conditions.

Parameters
[in]ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
[in,out]cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
[in]climPointer to the climate structure containing climatological data.
[in,out]met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure for the initial timestep.
[in,out]met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure for the next timestep.
[in,out]atmPointer to the atmospheric structure containing particle data.

The function performs the following operations:

  • Allocates temporary arrays for random number generation.
  • Generates random numbers for simulating diffusion effects.
  • Loops over atmospheric particles to compute and apply:
    • Horizontal turbulent diffusion, based on prescribed diffusivity values.
    • Vertical turbulent diffusion, using vertical diffusivity values.
  • Cleans up allocated resources after processing.

Turbulent diffusivity parameters are derived from control inputs and weighted based on atmospheric layer influences (PBL, troposphere, stratosphere).

Note
  • Control parameters TURB_DX_PBL, TURB_DX_TROP, TURB_DX_STRAT, TURB_DZ_TROP and TURB_DZ_PBL, TURB_DZ_TROP, TURB_DZ_STRAT define horizontal and vertical diffusivities (in units of m**2 s**-1) in the PBL, troposphere, and stratosphere, respectively. The control parameter DIFF_MIX_PBL is used to switch vertical mixing in the PBL on or off.
  • Apply the following settings to reproduce Stohl et al. (2005): TURB_DX_PBL = 50 TURB_DX_TROP = 50 TURB_DX_STRAT = 0 TURB_DX_PBL = 0 TURB_DX_TROP = 0 TURB_DX_STRAT = 0.1 TURB_MESOX = 0.16 TURB_MESOZ = 0.16 DIFF_MIX_PBL = 0
  • Apply the following setting to reproduce Maryon et al. (1991) and Ryall et al. (1998): TURB_DX_PBL = 5300 TURB_DX_TROP = 1325 TURB_DX_STRAT = 1325 TURB_DX_PBL = 0 TURB_DX_TROP = 1.5 TURB_DX_STRAT = 1.5 TURB_MESOX = 0 TURB_MESOZ = 0 DIFF_MIX_PBL = 1
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 3851 of file mptrac.c.

3857 {
3858
3859 /* Set timer... */
3860 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_DIFF_TURB", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3861
3862 /* Create random numbers... */
3863 module_rng(ctl, cache->rs, 3 * (size_t) atm->np, 1);
3864
3865 /* Loop over particles... */
3866 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1,
3867 "acc data present(ctl,cache,clim,met0,met1,atm)") {
3868
3869 /* Get PBL and surface pressure... */
3870 double pbl, ps;
3871 INTPOL_INIT;
3872 INTPOL_2D(pbl, 1);
3873 INTPOL_2D(ps, 0);
3874
3875 /* Get weighting factors... */
3876 const double wpbl = pbl_weight(ctl, atm, ip, pbl, ps);
3877 const double wtrop = tropo_weight(clim, atm, ip) * (1.0 - wpbl);
3878 const double wstrat = 1.0 - wpbl - wtrop;
3879
3880 /* Set diffusivity... */
3881 const double dx = wpbl * ctl->turb_dx_pbl + wtrop * ctl->turb_dx_trop
3882 + wstrat * ctl->turb_dx_strat;
3883 const double dz = wpbl * ctl->turb_dz_pbl + wtrop * ctl->turb_dz_trop
3884 + wstrat * ctl->turb_dz_strat;
3885
3886 /* Horizontal turbulent diffusion... */
3887 if (dx > 0) {
3888 const double sigma = sqrt(2.0 * dx * fabs(cache->dt[ip])) / 1000.;
3889 atm->lon[ip] += DX2DEG(cache->rs[3 * ip] * sigma, atm->lat[ip]);
3890 atm->lat[ip] += DY2DEG(cache->rs[3 * ip + 1] * sigma);
3891 }
3892
3893 /* Vertical turbulent diffusion... */
3894 if (dz > 0) {
3895 const double sigma = sqrt(2.0 * dz * fabs(cache->dt[ip])) / 1000.;
3896 atm->p[ip] += DZ2DP(cache->rs[3 * ip + 2] * sigma, atm->p[ip]);
3897 }
3898 }
3899}
pbl_weight
double pbl_weight(const ctl_t *ctl, const atm_t *atm, const int ip, const double pbl, const double ps)
Computes a weighting factor based on planetary boundary layer pressure.

◆ module_dry_depo()

void module_dry_depo ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Simulate dry deposition of atmospheric particles.

This function simulates the dry deposition of atmospheric particles, including both particulate matter and gases. It calculates the sedimentation velocity for particles based on the atmospheric properties and applies it to determine the loss of mass or volume mixing ratio due to deposition. The function loops over each particle and calculates the loss of mass or volume mixing ratio based on the deposition velocity and time step.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the current time step.
met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the next time step.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 3903 of file mptrac.c.

3908 {
3909
3910 /* Set timer... */
3911 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_DRY_DEPO", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3912
3913 /* Check quantity flags... */
3914 if (ctl->qnt_m < 0 && ctl->qnt_vmr < 0)
3915 ERRMSG("Module needs quantity mass or volume mixing ratio!");
3916
3917 /* Loop over particles... */
3918 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1, "acc data present(ctl,cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
3919
3920 /* Get surface pressure... */
3921 double ps;
3922 INTPOL_INIT;
3923 INTPOL_2D(ps, 1);
3924
3925 /* Check whether particle is above the surface layer... */
3926 if (atm->p[ip] < ps - ctl->dry_depo_dp)
3927 continue;
3928
3929 /* Set depth of surface layer... */
3930 const double dz = 1000. * (Z(ps - ctl->dry_depo_dp) - Z(ps));
3931
3932 /* Calculate sedimentation velocity for particles... */
3933 double v_dep;
3934 if (ctl->qnt_rp > 0 && ctl->qnt_rhop > 0) {
3935
3936 /* Get temperature... */
3937 double t;
3938 INTPOL_3D(t, 1);
3939
3940 /* Set deposition velocity... */
3941 v_dep = sedi(atm->p[ip], t, atm->q[ctl->qnt_rp][ip],
3942 atm->q[ctl->qnt_rhop][ip]);
3943 }
3944
3945 /* Use explicit sedimentation velocity for gases... */
3946 else
3947 v_dep = ctl->dry_depo_vdep;
3948
3949 /* Calculate loss of mass based on deposition velocity... */
3950 const double aux = exp(-cache->dt[ip] * v_dep / dz);
3951 if (ctl->qnt_m >= 0) {
3952 if (ctl->qnt_mloss_dry >= 0)
3953 atm->q[ctl->qnt_mloss_dry][ip]
3954 += atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] * (1 - aux);
3955 atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] *= aux;
3956 if (ctl->qnt_loss_rate >= 0)
3957 atm->q[ctl->qnt_loss_rate][ip] += v_dep / dz;
3958 }
3959 if (ctl->qnt_vmr >= 0)
3960 atm->q[ctl->qnt_vmr][ip] *= aux;
3961 }
3962}
sedi
double sedi(const double p, const double T, const double rp, const double rhop)
Calculates the sedimentation velocity of a particle in air.

int qnt_rhop

Dry deposition surface layer [hPa].

int qnt_mloss_dry
Quantity array index for total mass loss due to dry deposition.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_h2o2_chem()

void module_h2o2_chem ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
const clim_t *  clim,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Perform chemical reactions involving H2O2 within cloud particles.

This function simulates chemical reactions involving hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) within cloud particles. It calculates the change in H2O2 concentration over time due to chemical reactions. The reaction rates are determined based on temperature and cloud properties such as liquid water content.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
climPointer to the climatological data structure.
met0Pointer to the first meteorological data structure.
met1Pointer to the second meteorological data structure.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
Note
The function assumes that the necessary control structure (ctl), climatological data structure (clim), meteorological data structures (met0, met1), and atmospheric data structure (atm) have been initialized and are accessible.
Chemical reactions involving H2O2 are simulated for particles within clouds, as indicated by a positive liquid water content (LWC).
The function calculates reaction rates based on temperature and cloud properties, including the liquid water content (LWC) and the concentration of SO2.
The exponential decay of H2O2 concentration due to chemical reactions is calculated using the reaction rate coefficient and the time step (dt) for each particle.
If the particle has a quantity flag for either mass (ctl->qnt_m) or volume mixing ratio (ctl->qnt_vmr), the function updates the quantity based on the exponential decay.
If the particle has a loss rate quantity flag (ctl->qnt_loss_rate), the function accumulates the reaction rate coefficient to quantify the loss rate.
Author
Mingzhao Liu

Definition at line 3966 of file mptrac.c.

3972 {
3973
3974 /* Set timer... */
3975 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_H2O2_CHEM", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
3976
3977 /* Check quantity flags... */
3978 if (ctl->qnt_m < 0 && ctl->qnt_vmr < 0)
3979 ERRMSG("Module needs quantity mass or volume mixing ratio!");
3980
3981 /* Parameter of SO2 correction... */
3982 const double a = 3.12541941e-06;
3983 const double b = -5.72532259e-01;
3984 const double low = pow(1. / a, 1. / b);
3985
3986 /* Loop over particles... */
3987 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1, "acc data present(ctl,cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
3988
3989 /* Check whether particle is inside cloud... */
3990 double lwc, rwc;
3991 INTPOL_INIT;
3992 INTPOL_3D(lwc, 1);
3993 INTPOL_3D(rwc, 0);
3994 if (!(lwc > 0 || rwc > 0))
3995 continue;
3996
3997 /* Get temperature... */
3998 double t;
3999 INTPOL_3D(t, 0);
4000
4001 /* Get molecular density... */
4002 const double M = MOLEC_DENS(atm->p[ip], t);
4003
4004 /* Reaction rate (Berglen et al., 2004)... */
4005 const double k = 9.1e7 * exp(-29700. / RI * (1. / t - 1. / 298.15)); /* (Maass, 1999), unit: M^(-2) */
4006
4007 /* Henry constant of SO2... */
4008 const double H_SO2 =
4009 1.3e-2 * exp(2900. * (1. / t - 1. / 298.15)) * RI * t;
4010 const double K_1S = 1.23e-2 * exp(2.01e3 * (1. / t - 1. / 298.15)); /* unit: mol/L */
4011
4012 /* Henry constant of H2O2... */
4013 const double H_h2o2 =
4014 8.3e2 * exp(7600. * (1. / t - 1. / 298.15)) * RI * t;
4015
4016 /* Correction factor for high SO2 concentration
4017 (if qnt_Cx is defined, the correction is switched on)... */
4018 double cor = 1.0;
4019 if (ctl->qnt_Cx >= 0)
4020 cor = atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cx][ip] >
4021 low ? a * pow(atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cx][ip], b) : 1;
4022
4023 const double h2o2 = H_h2o2
4024 * clim_zm(&clim->h2o2, atm->time[ip], atm->lat[ip], atm->p[ip])
4025 * M * cor * 1000. / AVO; /* unit: mol/L */
4026
4027 /* Volume water content in cloud [m^3 m^(-3)]... */
4028 const double rho_air = atm->p[ip] / (RI * t) * MA / 10.;
4029 const double CWC = (lwc + rwc) * rho_air / 1e3;
4030
4031 /* Calculate exponential decay (Rolph et al., 1992)... */
4032 const double rate_coef = k * K_1S * h2o2 * H_SO2 * CWC;
4033 const double aux = exp(-cache->dt[ip] * rate_coef);
4034 if (ctl->qnt_m >= 0) {
4035 if (ctl->qnt_mloss_h2o2 >= 0)
4036 atm->q[ctl->qnt_mloss_h2o2][ip] += atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] * (1 - aux);
4037 atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] *= aux;
4038 if (ctl->qnt_loss_rate >= 0)
4039 atm->q[ctl->qnt_loss_rate][ip] += rate_coef;
4040 }
4041 if (ctl->qnt_vmr >= 0)
4042 atm->q[ctl->qnt_vmr][ip] *= aux;
4043 }
4044}
AVO
#define AVO
Avogadro constant [1/mol].
Definition: mptrac.h:199
MOLEC_DENS
#define MOLEC_DENS(p, t)
Calculate the density of a gas molecule.
Definition: mptrac.h:1131
RI
#define RI
Ideal gas constant [J/(mol K)].
Definition: mptrac.h:269
ctl_t::qnt_mloss_h2o2
int qnt_mloss_h2o2
Quantity array index for total mass loss due to H2O2 chemistry.
Definition: mptrac.h:2417
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ module_isosurf_init()

void module_isosurf_init ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
cache_t *  cache,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Initialize the isosurface module based on atmospheric data.

This function initializes the isosurface module based on the atmospheric data provided. It calculates the necessary variables required for generating the isosurface, such as pressure, density, or potential temperature. Additionally, it can read balloon pressure data from a file if specified in the control structure. The initialized data is stored in the cache for later use.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the current time step.
met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the next time step.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
cachePointer to the cache structure for storing initialized data.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 4048 of file mptrac.c.

4053 {
4054
4055 double t;
4056
4057 /* Set timer... */
4058 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_ISOSURF_INIT", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
4059
4060 /* Save pressure... */
4061 if (ctl->isosurf == 1) {
4062 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 0, "acc data present(cache,atm)") {
4063 cache->iso_var[ip] = atm->p[ip];
4064 }
4065 }
4066
4067 /* Save density... */
4068 else if (ctl->isosurf == 2) {
4069 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 0, "acc data present(cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
4070 INTPOL_INIT;
4071 INTPOL_3D(t, 1);
4072 cache->iso_var[ip] = atm->p[ip] / t;
4073 }
4074 }
4075
4076 /* Save potential temperature... */
4077 else if (ctl->isosurf == 3) {
4078 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 0, "acc data present(cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
4079 INTPOL_INIT;
4080 INTPOL_3D(t, 1);
4081 cache->iso_var[ip] = THETA(atm->p[ip], t);
4082 }
4083 }
4084
4085 /* Read balloon pressure data... */
4086 else if (ctl->isosurf == 4) {
4087
4088 /* Write info... */
4089 LOG(1, "Read balloon pressure data: %s", ctl->balloon);
4090
4091 /* Open file... */
4092 FILE *in;
4093 if (!(in = fopen(ctl->balloon, "r")))
4094 ERRMSG("Cannot open file!");
4095
4096 /* Read pressure time series... */
4097 char line[LEN];
4098 while (fgets(line, LEN, in))
4099 if (sscanf(line, "%lg %lg", &(cache->iso_ts[cache->iso_n]),
4100 &(cache->iso_ps[cache->iso_n])) == 2)
4101 if ((++cache->iso_n) > NP)
4102 ERRMSG("Too many data points!");
4103
4104 /* Check number of points... */
4105 if (cache->iso_n < 1)
4106 ERRMSG("Could not read any data!");
4107
4108 /* Close file... */
4109 fclose(in);
4110
4111 /* Update of cache data on device... */
4112 mptrac_update_device(NULL, cache, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
4113 }
4114}

◆ module_isosurf()

void module_isosurf ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Apply the isosurface module to adjust atmospheric properties.

This function applies the isosurface module to adjust atmospheric properties based on the initialized data stored in the cache. It interpolates and restores atmospheric pressure, density, or potential temperature according to the specified isosurface mode in the control structure.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the current time step.
met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the next time step.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 4118 of file mptrac.c.

4123 {
4124
4125 /* Set timer... */
4126 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_ISOSURF", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
4127
4128 /* Loop over particles... */
4129 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 0, "acc data present(ctl,cache,met0,met1,atm)") {
4130
4131 /* Init... */
4132 double t;
4133 INTPOL_INIT;
4134
4135 /* Restore pressure... */
4136 if (ctl->isosurf == 1)
4137 atm->p[ip] = cache->iso_var[ip];
4138
4139 /* Restore density... */
4140 else if (ctl->isosurf == 2) {
4141 INTPOL_3D(t, 1);
4142 atm->p[ip] = cache->iso_var[ip] * t;
4143 }
4144
4145 /* Restore potential temperature... */
4146 else if (ctl->isosurf == 3) {
4147 INTPOL_3D(t, 1);
4148 atm->p[ip] = 1000. * pow(cache->iso_var[ip] / t, -1. / 0.286);
4149 }
4150
4151 /* Interpolate pressure... */
4152 else if (ctl->isosurf == 4) {
4153 if (atm->time[ip] <= cache->iso_ts[0])
4154 atm->p[ip] = cache->iso_ps[0];
4155 else if (atm->time[ip] >= cache->iso_ts[cache->iso_n - 1])
4156 atm->p[ip] = cache->iso_ps[cache->iso_n - 1];
4157 else {
4158 const int idx =
4159 locate_irr(cache->iso_ts, cache->iso_n, atm->time[ip]);
4160 atm->p[ip] =
4161 LIN(cache->iso_ts[idx], cache->iso_ps[idx], cache->iso_ts[idx + 1],
4162 cache->iso_ps[idx + 1], atm->time[ip]);
4163 }
4164 }
4165 }
4166}

void module_meteo ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
const clim_t *  clim,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Update atmospheric properties using meteorological data.

This function updates atmospheric properties based on meteorological data interpolated between two time steps. It calculates various atmospheric quantities such as pressure, temperature, wind speed, humidity, etc., and updates the corresponding fields in the atmospheric data structure.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
climPointer to the climate data structure containing climatological data.
met0Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the current time step.
met1Pointer to the meteorological data structure at the next time step.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

◆ module_mixing()

void module_mixing ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const clim_t *  clim,
atm_t *  atm,
const double  t 
)

Update atmospheric properties through interparcel mixing.

This function updates atmospheric properties by performing interparcel mixing based on the given meteorological and climatological data. It calculates the indices of grid boxes and performs mixing for various quantities such as mass, volume mixing ratio, and other chemical species concentrations.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
climPointer to the climate data structure containing climatological data.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
tTime at which mixing is performed.
Author
Mingzhao Liu
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 4329 of file mptrac.c.

4333 {
4334
4335 /* Set timer... */
4336 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_MIXING", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
4337
4338 /* Allocate... */
4339 const int np = atm->np;
4340 int *restrict const ixs = (int *) malloc((size_t) np * sizeof(int));
4341 int *restrict const iys = (int *) malloc((size_t) np * sizeof(int));
4342 int *restrict const izs = (int *) malloc((size_t) np * sizeof(int));
4343
4344 /* Set grid box size... */
4345 const double dz = (ctl->mixing_z1 - ctl->mixing_z0) / ctl->mixing_nz;
4346 const double dlon = (ctl->mixing_lon1 - ctl->mixing_lon0) / ctl->mixing_nx;
4347 const double dlat = (ctl->mixing_lat1 - ctl->mixing_lat0) / ctl->mixing_ny;
4348
4349 /* Set time interval... */
4350 const double t0 = t - 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
4351 const double t1 = t + 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
4352
4353 /* Get indices... */
4354#ifdef _OPENACC
4355#pragma acc enter data create(ixs[0:np],iys[0:np],izs[0:np])
4356#pragma acc data present(ctl,clim,atm,ixs,iys,izs)
4357#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
4358#else
4359#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
4360#endif
4361 for (int ip = 0; ip < np; ip++) {
4362 ixs[ip] = (int) ((atm->lon[ip] - ctl->mixing_lon0) / dlon);
4363 iys[ip] = (int) ((atm->lat[ip] - ctl->mixing_lat0) / dlat);
4364 izs[ip] = (int) ((Z(atm->p[ip]) - ctl->mixing_z0) / dz);
4365 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1
4366 || ixs[ip] < 0 || ixs[ip] >= ctl->mixing_nx
4367 || iys[ip] < 0 || iys[ip] >= ctl->mixing_ny
4368 || izs[ip] < 0 || izs[ip] >= ctl->mixing_nz)
4369 izs[ip] = -1;
4370 }
4371
4372 /* Calculate interparcel mixing... */
4373 const int use_ensemble = (ctl->nens > 0);
4374
4375 const int quantities[] = {
4376 ctl->qnt_m, ctl->qnt_vmr, ctl->qnt_Ch2o, ctl->qnt_Co3,
4377 ctl->qnt_Cco, ctl->qnt_Coh, ctl->qnt_Ch, ctl->qnt_Cho2,
4378 ctl->qnt_Ch2o2, ctl->qnt_Co1d, ctl->qnt_Co3p, ctl->qnt_Cccl4,
4379 ctl->qnt_Cccl3f, ctl->qnt_Cccl2f2, ctl->qnt_Cn2o,
4380 ctl->qnt_Csf6, ctl->qnt_aoa
4381 };
4382 const int n_qnt = sizeof(quantities) / sizeof(quantities[0]);
4383
4384 for (int i = 0; i < n_qnt; i++)
4385 if (quantities[i] >= 0)
4386 module_mixing_help(ctl, clim, atm, ixs, iys, izs, quantities[i],
4387 use_ensemble);
4388
4389 /* Free... */
4390#ifdef _OPENACC
4391#pragma acc exit data delete(ixs,iys,izs)
4392#endif
4393 free(ixs);
4394 free(iys);
4395 free(izs);
4396}

Perform subgrid-scale interparcel mixing of a given quantity.

◆ module_mixing_help()

void module_mixing_help ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const clim_t *  clim,
atm_t *  atm,
const int *  ixs,
const int *  iys,
const int *  izs,
const int  qnt_idx,
const int  use_ensemble 
)

Perform subgrid-scale interparcel mixing of a given quantity.

This function computes the average of a specified quantity within each subgrid box (and optionally for each ensemble member) and applies a mixing adjustment to particle values based on the computed local mean.

The mixing accounts for differences in tropopause and stratosphere mixing via a weighted parameterization. It supports both ensemble and non-ensemble modes using the use_ensemble flag.

Parameters
[in]ctlPointer to control/configuration structure.
[in]climPointer to climatological data structure.
[in,out]atmPointer to atmospheric state (includes particles).
[in]ixsArray of x-grid indices for each particle.
[in]iysArray of y-grid indices for each particle.
[in]izsArray of z-grid indices for each particle (-1 for invalid).
[in]qnt_idxIndex of the quantity in atm->q to be mixed.
[in]use_ensembleFlag indicating whether to use ensemble-aware logic (0 = no, 1 = yes).
Note
Particles with izs[ip] < 0 are excluded from mixing.
Uses OpenACC or OpenMP for parallelism depending on compilation options.
Requires ctl->qnt_ens to be valid if use_ensemble is true.
Author
Mingzhao Liu
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 4400 of file mptrac.c.

4408 {
4409
4410 const int np = atm->np;
4411 const int ngrid = ctl->mixing_nx * ctl->mixing_ny * ctl->mixing_nz;
4412 const int nens = use_ensemble ? ctl->nens : 1;
4413 const int total_grid = ngrid * nens;
4414
4415 double *restrict const cmean =
4416 (double *) malloc((size_t) total_grid * sizeof(double));
4417 int *restrict const count =
4418 (int *) malloc((size_t) total_grid * sizeof(int));
4419
4420 /* Init... */
4421#ifdef _OPENACC
4422#pragma acc enter data create(cmean[0:total_grid],count[0:total_grid])
4423#pragma acc data present(ctl,clim,atm,ixs,iys,izs,cmean,count)
4424#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
4425#else
4426#ifdef __NVCOMPILER
4427#pragma novector
4428#endif
4429#pragma omp parallel for
4430#endif
4431 for (int i = 0; i < total_grid; i++) {
4432 count[i] = 0;
4433 cmean[i] = 0.0;
4434 }
4435
4436 /* Loop over particles... */
4437#ifdef _OPENACC
4438#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
4439#endif
4440 for (int ip = 0; ip < np; ip++)
4441 if (izs[ip] >= 0) {
4442 const int ens = use_ensemble ? (int) atm->q[ctl->qnt_ens][ip] : 0;
4443 const int idx =
4444 ens * ngrid + ARRAY_3D(ixs[ip], iys[ip], ctl->mixing_ny, izs[ip],
4445 ctl->mixing_nz);
4446#ifdef _OPENACC
4447#pragma acc atomic update
4448#endif
4449 cmean[idx] += atm->q[qnt_idx][ip];
4450#ifdef _OPENACC
4451#pragma acc atomic update
4452#endif
4453 count[idx]++;
4454 }
4455
4456 /* Compute means... */
4457#ifdef _OPENACC
4458#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
4459#else
4460#ifdef __NVCOMPILER
4461#pragma novector
4462#endif
4463#pragma omp parallel for
4464#endif
4465 for (int i = 0; i < total_grid; i++)
4466 if (count[i] > 0)
4467 cmean[i] /= count[i];
4468
4469 /* Interparcel mixing... */
4470#ifdef _OPENACC
4471#pragma acc parallel loop independent gang vector
4472#else
4473#pragma omp parallel for
4474#endif
4475 for (int ip = 0; ip < np; ip++) {
4476 if (izs[ip] >= 0) {
4477 const int ens = use_ensemble ? (int) atm->q[ctl->qnt_ens][ip] : 0;
4478
4479 double mixparam = 1.0;
4480 if (ctl->mixing_trop < 1 || ctl->mixing_strat < 1) {
4481 const double w = tropo_weight(clim, atm, ip);
4482 mixparam = w * ctl->mixing_trop + (1.0 - w) * ctl->mixing_strat;
4483 }
4484
4485 const int idx =
4486 ens * ngrid + ARRAY_3D(ixs[ip], iys[ip], ctl->mixing_ny, izs[ip],
4487 ctl->mixing_nz);
4488 atm->q[qnt_idx][ip] += (cmean[idx] - atm->q[qnt_idx][ip]) * mixparam;
4489 }
4490 }
4491
4492 /* Free... */
4493#ifdef _OPENACC
4494#pragma acc exit data delete(cmean,count)
4495#endif
4496 free(cmean);
4497 free(count);
4498}
ctl_t::mixing_trop
double mixing_trop
Interparcel exchange parameter for mixing in the troposphere.

Interparcel exchange parameter for mixing in the stratosphere.

◆ module_oh_chem()

void module_oh_chem ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const cache_t *  cache,
const clim_t *  clim,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
atm_t *  atm 
)

Perform hydroxyl chemistry calculations for atmospheric particles.

This function calculates the OH chemistry for each atmospheric particle based on the specified reaction mechanism and updates the particle quantities accordingly. The OH chemistry includes bimolecular and termolecular reactions, and the reaction rates are calculated based on the provided climatological data and atmospheric conditions. The function supports both mass and volume mixing ratio quantities for the particles.

Parameters
ctlPointer to the control structure containing simulation parameters.
cachePointer to the cache structure for temporary data and random numbers.
climPointer to the climate data structure containing climatological data.
met0Pointer to the first meteorological data structure.
met1Pointer to the second meteorological data structure.
atmPointer to the atmospheric data structure containing particle information.
Note
The function assumes that the necessary meteorological and climatological data structures have been initialized and are accessible via the pointers met0, met1, and clim, respectively.
The reaction rates are calculated based on the provided reaction mechanism and atmospheric conditions, including temperature, pressure, and the concentrations of relevant species.
The function updates the particle quantities based on the calculated reaction rates and the specified time steps. The update can include both mass and volume mixing ratio quantities, as determined by the control structure (ctl).
Author
Lars Hoffmann
Mingzhao Liu

Definition at line 4502 of file mptrac.c.

4508 {
4509
4510 /* Set timer... */
4511 SELECT_TIMER("MODULE_OH_CHEM", "PHYSICS", NVTX_GPU);
4512
4513 /* Check quantity flags... */
4514 if (ctl->qnt_m < 0 && ctl->qnt_vmr < 0)
4515 ERRMSG("Module needs quantity mass or volume mixing ratio!");
4516
4517 /* Parameter of SO2 correction... */
4518 const double a = 4.71572206e-08;
4519 const double b = -8.28782867e-01;
4520 const double low = pow(1. / a, 1. / b);
4521
4522 /* Loop over particles... */
4523 PARTICLE_LOOP(0, atm->np, 1,
4524 "acc data present(ctl,cache,clim,met0,met1,atm)") {
4525
4526 /* Get temperature... */
4527 double t;
4528 INTPOL_INIT;
4529 INTPOL_3D(t, 1);
4530
4531 /* Calculate molecular density... */
4532 const double M = MOLEC_DENS(atm->p[ip], t);
4533
4534 /* Use constant reaction rate... */
4535 double k = NAN;
4536 if (ctl->oh_chem_reaction == 1)
4537 k = ctl->oh_chem[0];
4538
4539 /* Calculate bimolecular reaction rate... */
4540 else if (ctl->oh_chem_reaction == 2)
4541 k = ctl->oh_chem[0] * exp(-ctl->oh_chem[1] / t);
4542
4543 /* Calculate termolecular reaction rate... */
4544 if (ctl->oh_chem_reaction == 3) {
4545
4546 /* Calculate rate coefficient for X + OH + M -> XOH + M
4547 (JPL Publication 19-05) ... */
4548 const double k0 =
4549 ctl->oh_chem[0] * (ctl->oh_chem[1] !=
4550 0 ? pow(298. / t, ctl->oh_chem[1]) : 1.);
4551 const double ki =
4552 ctl->oh_chem[2] * (ctl->oh_chem[3] !=
4553 0 ? pow(298. / t, ctl->oh_chem[3]) : 1.);
4554 const double c = log10(k0 * M / ki);
4555 k = k0 * M / (1. + k0 * M / ki) * pow(0.6, 1. / (1. + c * c));
4556 }
4557
4558 /* Correction factor for high SO2 concentration
4559 (if qnt_Cx is defined, the correction is switched on)... */
4560 double cor = 1;
4561 if (ctl->qnt_Cx >= 0)
4562 cor =
4563 atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cx][ip] >
4564 low ? a * pow(atm->q[ctl->qnt_Cx][ip], b) : 1;
4565
4566 /* Calculate exponential decay... */
4567 const double rate_coef =
4568 k * clim_oh(ctl, clim, atm->time[ip], atm->lon[ip],
4569 atm->lat[ip], atm->p[ip]) * M * cor;
4570 const double aux = exp(-cache->dt[ip] * rate_coef);
4571 if (ctl->qnt_m >= 0) {
4572 if (ctl->qnt_mloss_oh >= 0)
4573 atm->q[ctl->qnt_mloss_oh][ip]
4574 += atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] * (1 - aux);
4575 atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip] *= aux;
4576 if (ctl->qnt_loss_rate >= 0)
4577 atm->q[ctl->qnt_loss_rate][ip] += rate_coef;
4578 }
4579 if (ctl->qnt_vmr >= 0)
4580 atm->q[ctl->qnt_vmr][ip] *= aux;
4581 }
4582}
ctl_t::oh_chem
double oh_chem[4]
Coefficients for OH reaction rate (A, E/R or k0, n, kinf, m).
Definition: mptrac.h:2947
ctl_t::oh_chem_reaction
int oh_chem_reaction
Reaction type for OH chemistry (0=none, 2=bimolecular, 3=termolecular).
Definition: mptrac.h:2944
ctl_t::qnt_mloss_oh
int qnt_mloss_oh
Quantity array index for total mass loss due to OH chemistry.
