7265 read_clim_photo_help(ncid, "J_H2O", photo, photo->h2o);
7266
7267 /* Close netCDF file... */
7268 NC(nc_close(ncid));
7269
7270 /* Write info... */
7271 LOG(2, "Number of pressure levels: %d", photo->np);
7272 LOG(2, "Altitude levels: %g, %g ... %g km",
7273 Z(photo->p[0]), Z(photo->p[1]), Z(photo->p[photo->np - 1]));
7274 LOG(2, "Pressure levels: %g, %g ... %g hPa",
7275 photo->p[0], photo->p[1], photo->p[photo->np - 1]);
7276 LOG(2, "Number of solar zenith angles: %d", photo->nsza);
7277 LOG(2, "Solar zenith angles: %g, %g ... %g deg",
7278 RAD2DEG(photo->sza[0]), RAD2DEG(photo->sza[1]),
7279 RAD2DEG(photo->sza[photo->nsza - 1]));
7280 LOG(2, "Number of total column ozone values: %d", photo->no3c);
7281 LOG(2, "Total column ozone: %g, %g ... %g DU",
7282 photo->o3c[0], photo->o3c[1], photo->o3c[photo->no3c - 1]);
7283 LOG(2, "N2O photolysis rate: %g, %g ... %g s**-1",
7284 photo->n2o[0][0][0], photo->n2o[1][0][0],
7285 photo->n2o[photo->np - 1][photo->nsza - 1][photo->no3c - 1]);
7286 LOG(2, "CCl4 photolysis rate: %g, %g ... %g s**-1",
7287 photo->ccl4[0][0][0], photo->ccl4[1][0][0],
7288 photo->ccl4[photo->np - 1][photo->nsza - 1][photo->no3c - 1]);

◆ read_clim_photo_help()

void read_clim_photo_help ( const int  ncid,
const char *  varname,
const clim_photo_t *  photo,
double  var[CP][CSZA][CO3] 
)

Reads a 3D climatological photochemistry variable from a NetCDF file.

This function reads a variable from a NetCDF file into a 3D array based on the dimensions provided by the clim_photo_t structure.

Parameters
[in]ncidNetCDF file ID.
[in]varnameName of the variable to read from the NetCDF file.
[in]photoPointer to a structure defining the data dimensions (np, nsza, no3c).
[out]var3D array to store the read data, with dimensions [CP][CSZA][CO3].
Note
Allocates temporary memory for reading and copies data into the provided array. The memory is freed after the data is copied.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7314 of file mptrac.c.

7318 {

7320 /* Allocate... */
7321 double *help;
7322 ALLOC(help, double,
7323 photo->np * photo->nsza * photo->no3c);
7324
7325 /* Read varible... */

7327 NC_GET_DOUBLE(varname, help, 1);
7328

7336 /* Free... */

◆ read_clim_ts()

int read_clim_ts ( const char *  filename,
clim_ts_t *  ts 
)

Reads a climatological time series from a file and populates the given time series structure.

This function reads time and volume mixing ratio (VMR) data from a specified file, processes the data, and stores it in the provided clim_ts_t structure. It also includes checks for data consistency and logs detailed information about the loaded data.

Parameters
filenameA string containing the path to the file containing the climatological time series data.
tsA pointer to the time series structure (clim_ts_t) that will be populated with the data.
Returns
Returns 1 on success, and 0 on failure (e.g., if the file cannot be opened or data is invalid).

The function performs the following steps:

  • Logs the initiation of reading the climatological time series.
  • Opens the file for reading.
  • Reads time and VMR data from the file, converting years to seconds.
  • Checks for ascending order of time data and ensures the number of data points does not exceed the limit.
  • Closes the file after reading.
  • Checks if there are enough data points.
  • Logs detailed information about the loaded data, including the number of time steps and the range of VMR values.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7342 of file mptrac.c.

7344 {
7345
7346 /* Write info... */
7347 LOG(1, "Read climatological time series: %s", filename);
7348
7349 /* Open file... */
7350 FILE *in;
7351 if (!(in = fopen(filename, "r"))) {
7352 WARN("Cannot open file!");
7353 return 0;
7354 }
7355
7356 /* Read data... */
7357 char line[LEN];
7358 int nh = 0;
7359 while (fgets(line, LEN, in))
7360 if (sscanf(line, "%lg %lg", &ts->time[nh], &ts->vmr[nh]) == 2) {
7361
7362 /* Convert years to seconds... */
7363 ts->time[nh] = (ts->time[nh] - 2000.0) * 365.25 * 86400.;
7364
7365 /* Check data... */
7366 if (nh > 0 && ts->time[nh] <= ts->time[nh - 1])
7367 ERRMSG("Time series must be ascending!");
7368
7369 /* Count time steps... */
7370 if ((++nh) >= CTS)
7371 ERRMSG("Too many data points!");
7372 }
7373
7374 /* Close file... */
7375 fclose(in);
7376
7377 /* Check number of data points... */
7378 ts->ntime = nh;
7379 if (nh < 2)
7380 ERRMSG("Not enough data points!");
7381
7382 /* Write info... */
7383 LOG(2, "Number of time steps: %d", ts->ntime);
7384 LOG(2, "Time steps: %.2f, %.2f ... %.2f s", ts->time[0], ts->time[1],
7385 ts->time[nh - 1]);
7386 LOG(2, "Volume mixing ratio range: %g ... %g ppv",
7387 gsl_stats_min(ts->vmr, 1, (size_t) nh), gsl_stats_max(ts->vmr, 1,
7388 (size_t) nh));
7389
7390 /* Exit success... */
7391 return 1;
7392}
CTS
#define CTS
Maximum number of data points of climatological time series.
Definition: mptrac.h:363

◆ read_clim_zm()

void read_clim_zm ( const char *  filename,
const char *  varname,
clim_zm_t *  zm 
)

Reads zonally averaged climatological data from a netCDF file and populates the given structure.

This function reads data from a specified netCDF file, including pressure levels, latitudes, and volume mixing ratios (VMR) for a specified variable. It performs necessary checks and logs detailed information about the loaded data.

Parameters
filenameA string containing the path to the netCDF file.
varnameA string containing the name of the variable to be read from the netCDF file.
zmA pointer to the structure (clim_zm_t) that will be populated with the data.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Logs the initiation of reading the specified data.
  • Opens the netCDF file for reading.
  • Reads pressure level data and checks for descending order.
  • Reads latitude data and checks for ascending order.
  • Sets the time data for monthly means.
  • Checks the number of time steps.
  • Reads the specified variable data from the file.
  • Fixes any gaps in the data by interpolating from valid values.
  • Logs detailed information about the loaded data, including the number of time steps, pressure levels, latitude values, and the range of the variable's volume mixing ratios.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7396 of file mptrac.c.

7399 {
7400
7401 int ncid, varid, it, iy, iz, iz2, nt;
7402
7403 double *help, varmin = 1e99, varmax = -1e99;
7404
7405 /* Write info... */
7406 LOG(1, "Read %s data: %s", varname, filename);
7407
7408 /* Open netCDF file... */
7409 if (nc_open(filename, NC_NOWRITE, &ncid) != NC_NOERR) {
7410 WARN("%s climatology data are missing!", varname);
7411 return;
7412 }
7413
7414 /* Read pressure data... */
7415 NC_INQ_DIM("press", &zm->np, 2, CP, 1);
7416 NC_GET_DOUBLE("press", zm->p, 1);
7417 if (zm->p[0] < zm->p[1])
7418 ERRMSG("Pressure data are not descending!");
7419
7420 /* Read latitudes... */
7421 NC_INQ_DIM("lat", &zm->nlat, 2, CY, 1);
7422 NC_GET_DOUBLE("lat", zm->lat, 1);
7423 if (zm->lat[0] > zm->lat[1])
7424 ERRMSG("Latitude data are not ascending!");
7425
7426 /* Set time data (for monthly means)... */
7427 zm->ntime = 12;
7428 zm->time[0] = 1209600.00;
7429 zm->time[1] = 3888000.00;
7430 zm->time[2] = 6393600.00;
7431 zm->time[3] = 9072000.00;
7432 zm->time[4] = 11664000.00;
7433 zm->time[5] = 14342400.00;
7434 zm->time[6] = 16934400.00;
7435 zm->time[7] = 19612800.00;
7436 zm->time[8] = 22291200.00;
7437 zm->time[9] = 24883200.00;
7438 zm->time[10] = 27561600.00;
7439 zm->time[11] = 30153600.00;
7440
7441 /* Check number of timesteps... */
7442 NC_INQ_DIM("time", &nt, 12, 12, 1);
7443
7444 /* Read data... */
7445 ALLOC(help, double,
7446 zm->nlat * zm->np * zm->ntime);
7447 NC_GET_DOUBLE(varname, help, 1);
7448 for (it = 0; it < zm->ntime; it++)
7449 for (iz = 0; iz < zm->np; iz++)
7450 for (iy = 0; iy < zm->nlat; iy++)
7451 zm->vmr[it][iz][iy] = help[ARRAY_3D(it, iz, zm->np, iy, zm->nlat)];
7452 free(help);
7453
7454 /* Fix data gaps... */
7455 for (it = 0; it < zm->ntime; it++)
7456 for (iy = 0; iy < zm->nlat; iy++)
7457 for (iz = 0; iz < zm->np; iz++) {
7458 if (zm->vmr[it][iz][iy] < 0) {
7459 for (iz2 = 0; iz2 < zm->np; iz2++)
7460 if (zm->vmr[it][iz2][iy] >= 0) {
7461 zm->vmr[it][iz][iy] = zm->vmr[it][iz2][iy];
7462 break;
7463 }
7464 for (iz2 = zm->np - 1; iz2 >= 0; iz2--)
7465 if (zm->vmr[it][iz2][iy] >= 0) {
7466 zm->vmr[it][iz][iy] = zm->vmr[it][iz2][iy];
7467 break;
7468 }
7469 }
7470 varmin = MIN(varmin, zm->vmr[it][iz][iy]);
7471 varmax = MAX(varmax, zm->vmr[it][iz][iy]);
7472 }
7473
7474 /* Close netCDF file... */
7475 NC(nc_close(ncid));
7476
7477 /* Write info... */
7478 LOG(2, "Number of time steps: %d", zm->ntime);
7479 LOG(2, "Time steps: %.2f, %.2f ... %.2f s",
7480 zm->time[0], zm->time[1], zm->time[zm->ntime - 1]);
7481 LOG(2, "Number of pressure levels: %d", zm->np);
7482 LOG(2, "Altitude levels: %g, %g ... %g km",
7483 Z(zm->p[0]), Z(zm->p[1]), Z(zm->p[zm->np - 1]));
7484 LOG(2, "Pressure levels: %g, %g ... %g hPa", zm->p[0],
7485 zm->p[1], zm->p[zm->np - 1]);
7486 LOG(2, "Number of latitudes: %d", zm->nlat);
7487 LOG(2, "Latitudes: %g, %g ... %g deg",
7488 zm->lat[0], zm->lat[1], zm->lat[zm->nlat - 1]);
7489 LOG(2, "%s volume mixing ratio range: %g ... %g ppv", varname, varmin,
7490 varmax);
7491}

#define CY

◆ read_kernel()

void read_kernel ( const char *  filename,
double  kz[EP],
double  kw[EP],
int *  nk 
)

Reads kernel function data from a file and populates the provided arrays.

This function reads kernel function data from a specified file, populating the provided arrays kz and kw with the parsed data. It also updates the variable pointed to by nk with the number of data points read. The function ensures that the height levels are in ascending order and performs checks for the number of height levels read.

Parameters
filenameA string containing the path to the file containing kernel function data.
kzA double array to store the height levels of the kernel function.
kwA double array to store the weights corresponding to the height levels.
nkA pointer to an integer variable representing the number of data points read.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Logs information indicating the kernel function file being read.
  • Attempts to open the specified file for reading.
  • Reads data from the file line by line, parsing height levels and weights.
  • Checks that the height levels are in ascending order and that the number of data points does not exceed the defined maximum.
  • Closes the file after reading.
  • Updates the value of nk with the number of data points read.
  • Normalizes the kernel function weights by dividing each weight by the maximum weight.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7495 of file mptrac.c.

7499 {
7500
7501 /* Write info... */
7502 LOG(1, "Read kernel function: %s", filename);
7503
7504 /* Open file... */
7505 FILE *in;
7506 if (!(in = fopen(filename, "r")))
7507 ERRMSG("Cannot open file!");
7508
7509 /* Read data... */
7510 char line[LEN];
7511 int n = 0;
7512 while (fgets(line, LEN, in))
7513 if (sscanf(line, "%lg %lg", &kz[n], &kw[n]) == 2) {
7514 if (n > 0 && kz[n] < kz[n - 1])
7515 ERRMSG("Height levels must be ascending!");
7516 if ((++n) >= EP)
7517 ERRMSG("Too many height levels!");
7518 }
7519
7520 /* Close file... */
7521 fclose(in);
7522
7523 /* Check number of data points... */
7524 *nk = n;
7525 if (n < 2)
7526 ERRMSG("Not enough height levels!");
7527
7528 /* Normalize kernel function... */
7529 const double kmax = gsl_stats_max(kw, 1, (size_t) n);
7530 for (int iz = 0; iz < n; iz++)
7531 kw[iz] /= kmax;
7532}

◆ read_met_bin()

int read_met_bin ( const char *  filename,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met 
)

Reads meteorological data from a binary file.

This function reads meteorological data from a binary file and populates the provided met_t structure with the data. It checks the binary file's format version and met_type, ensuring compatibility with the control structure (ctl_t). The function reads time, grid, surface data, and multi-level data, and supports different binary file versions.

Parameters
filenameA constant character pointer representing the name of the binary file to read the meteorological data from.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure that holds control parameters such as the expected met_type and other configuration options.
metA pointer to a met_t structure that will store the meteorological data read from the binary file.
Note
  • The function logs the progress and details of the read operation, such as time, number of longitudes, latitudes, levels, and various meteorological variables.
  • It uses the FREAD macro for safe binary reading operations, which checks the integrity of the read operation.
  • The function reads and verifies the met_type and binary file version to ensure compatibility.
  • Supported binary file versions include 100, 101, and 102, each of which may include additional variables (e.g., LSM, SST, RWC, SWC, and CC).
Warning
  • The function will raise an error if the met_type in the file does not match the ctl->met_type.
  • It will raise an error if the binary file version is not supported.
  • If the dimensions of the data (e.g., number of longitudes, latitudes, or levels) are outside the expected range, an error will be raised.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7536 of file mptrac.c.

7539 {
7540
7541 FILE *in;
7542
7543 double r;
7544
7545 int year, mon, day, hour, min, sec;
7546
7547 /* Set timer... */
7548 SELECT_TIMER("READ_MET_BIN", "INPUT", NVTX_READ);
7549
7550 /* Open file... */
7551 if (!(in = fopen(filename, "r"))) {
7552 WARN("Cannot open file!");
7553 return 0;
7554 }
7555
7556 /* Check type of binary data... */
7557 int met_type;
7558 FREAD(&met_type, int,
7559 1,
7560 in);
7561 if (met_type != ctl->met_type)
7562 ERRMSG("Wrong MET_TYPE of binary data!");
7563
7564 /* Check version of binary data... */
7565 int version;
7566 FREAD(&version, int,
7567 1,
7568 in);
7569 if (version != 103)
7570 ERRMSG("Wrong version of binary data!");
7571
7572 /* Read time... */
7573 FREAD(&met->time, double,
7574 1,
7575 in);
7576 jsec2time(met->time, &year, &mon, &day, &hour, &min, &sec, &r);
7577 LOG(2, "Time: %.2f (%d-%02d-%02d, %02d:%02d UTC)",
7578 met->time, year, mon, day, hour, min);
7579 if (year < 1900 || year > 2100 || mon < 1 || mon > 12
7580 || day < 1 || day > 31 || hour < 0 || hour > 23)
7581 ERRMSG("Error while reading time!");
7582
7583 /* Read dimensions... */
7584 FREAD(&met->nx, int,
7585 1,
7586 in);
7587 LOG(2, "Number of longitudes: %d", met->nx);
7588 if (met->nx < 2 || met->nx > EX)
7589 ERRMSG("Number of longitudes out of range!");
7590
7591 FREAD(&met->ny, int,
7592 1,
7593 in);
7594 LOG(2, "Number of latitudes: %d", met->ny);
7595 if (met->ny < 2 || met->ny > EY)
7596 ERRMSG("Number of latitudes out of range!");

7599 1,

7603 ERRMSG("Number of levels out of range!");

7607 (size_t) met->nx,
7608 in);
7609 LOG(2, "Longitudes: %g, %g ... %g deg",
7610 met->lon[0], met->lon[1], met->lon[met->nx - 1]);
7611
7612 FREAD(met->lat, double,
7613 (size_t) met->ny,

7615 LOG(2, "Latitudes: %g, %g ... %g deg",
7616 met->lat[0], met->lat[1], met->lat[met->ny - 1]);

7619 (size_t) met->np,
7620 in);

7623 LOG(2, "Pressure levels: %g, %g ... %g hPa",
7624 met->p[0], met->p[1], met->p[met->np - 1]);
7625
7626 /* Read surface data... */
7627 read_met_bin_2d(in, met, met->ps, "PS");
7628 read_met_bin_2d(in, met, met->ts, "TS");
7629 read_met_bin_2d(in, met, met->zs, "ZS");

7654 read_met_bin_3d(in, ctl, met, met->t, "T", 0, 1e34f);
7655 read_met_bin_3d(in, ctl, met, met->u, "U", -1e34f, 1e34f);

7658 read_met_bin_3d(in, ctl, met, met->pv, "PV", -1e34f, 1e34f);
7659 read_met_bin_3d(in, ctl, met, met->h2o, "H2O", 0, 1e34f);
7660 read_met_bin_3d(in, ctl, met, met->o3, "O3", 0, 1e34f);

7663 read_met_bin_3d(in, ctl, met, met->iwc, "IWC", 0, 1e34f);
7664 read_met_bin_3d(in, ctl, met, met->swc, "SWC", 0, 1e34f);
7665 read_met_bin_3d(in, ctl, met, met->cc, "CC", 0, 1);
7666
7667 /* Read final flag... */
7668 int final;
7669 FREAD(&final, int,
7670 1,
7671 in);
7672 if (final != 999)
7673 ERRMSG("Error while reading binary data!");
7674
7675 /* Close file... */
7676 fclose(in);
7677
7678 /* Return success... */
7679 return 1;
7680}

◆ read_met_bin_2d()

void read_met_bin_2d ( FILE *  in,
const met_t *  met,
float  var[EX][EY],
const char *  varname 
)

Reads a 2-dimensional meteorological variable from a binary file and stores it in the provided array.

This function reads a 2-dimensional meteorological variable from a binary file, which is assumed to be uncompressed, and stores it in the provided 2-dimensional array var. The variable name is used for logging purposes to identify the data being read.

Parameters
inA pointer to the FILE structure representing the binary file to read from.
metA pointer to a structure containing meteorological data.
varA 2-dimensional array to store the read variable.
varnameA string containing the name of the variable being read.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Allocates memory for a temporary buffer to hold the uncompressed data.
  • Logs information about the variable being read from the file.
  • Reads the uncompressed data from the file into the temporary buffer.
  • Copies the data from the temporary buffer to the provided 2-dimensional array.
  • Frees the memory allocated for the temporary buffer.
Note
The function assumes that the binary file contains uncompressed data and reads the data directly into the provided array without any additional processing.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7684 of file mptrac.c.

7688 {
7689
7690 float *help;
7691
7692 /* Allocate... */
7693 ALLOC(help, float,
7694 EX * EY);
7695
7696 /* Read uncompressed... */
7697 LOG(2, "Read 2-D variable: %s (uncompressed)", varname);
7698 FREAD(help, float,
7699 (size_t) (met->nx * met->ny),
7700 in);
7701
7702 /* Copy data... */
7703 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
7704 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
7705 var[ix][iy] = help[ARRAY_2D(ix, iy, met->ny)];
7706
7707 /* Free... */
7708 free(help);
7709}
ARRAY_2D
#define ARRAY_2D(ix, iy, ny)
Macro for computing the linear index of a 2D array element.
Definition: mptrac.h:439

◆ read_met_bin_3d()

void read_met_bin_3d ( FILE *  in,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
const met_t *  met,
float  var[EX][EY][EP],
const char *  varname,
const float  bound_min,
const float  bound_max 
)

Reads 3D meteorological data from a binary file, potentially using different compression methods.

This function reads 3-dimensional meteorological data from a binary file into a specified variable array. The data can be read in uncompressed form or using one of several supported compression methods. The data is then clamped to specified minimum and maximum bounds.

Parameters
[in]inPointer to the input file from which to read the data.
[in]ctlPointer to the control structure that contains metadata about the type of data and how it is stored.
[in]metPointer to the meteorological structure that contains the dimensions of the data.
[out]var3D array to store the read data, with dimensions [EX][EY][EP].
[in]varnameName of the variable being read, used for logging and debugging.
[in]bound_minMinimum bound to which data values should be clamped.
[in]bound_maxMaximum bound to which data values should be clamped.

The function supports the following types of data:

  • Uncompressed data
  • Packed data
  • ZFP compressed data (if compiled with ZFP support)
  • ZSTD compressed data (if compiled with ZSTD support)
  • cmultiscale compressed data (if compiled with CMS support)

Depending on the compression type specified in the control structure, the appropriate reading and decompression function is used. The data is read into a temporary buffer, then copied into the output array, applying the specified bounds to each value.

Note
The function assumes that the dimensions EX, EY, and EP are correctly defined and match the dimensions specified in the met structure.
If the appropriate compression support is not compiled, an error message is generated.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7713 of file mptrac.c.

7720 {
7721
7722 float *help;
7723
7724 /* Allocate... */
7725 ALLOC(help, float,
7726 EX * EY * EP);
7727
7728 /* Read uncompressed data... */
7729 if (ctl->met_type == 1) {
7730 LOG(2, "Read 3-D variable: %s (uncompressed)", varname);
7731 FREAD(help, float,
7732 (size_t) (met->nx * met->ny * met->np),
7733 in);
7734 }
7735
7736 /* Read packed data... */
7737 else if (ctl->met_type == 2)
7738 compress_pck(varname, help, (size_t) (met->ny * met->nx),
7739 (size_t) met->np, 1, in);
7740
7741 /* Read ZFP data... */
7742 else if (ctl->met_type == 3) {
7743#ifdef ZFP
7744 int precision;
7745 FREAD(&precision, int,
7746 1,
7747 in);
7748
7749 double tolerance;
7750 FREAD(&tolerance, double,
7751 1,
7752 in);
7753
7754 compress_zfp(varname, help, met->np, met->ny, met->nx, precision,
7755 tolerance, 1, in);
7756#else
7757 ERRMSG("MPTRAC was compiled without ZFP compression!");
7758#endif
7759 }
7760
7761 /* Read zstd data... */
7762 else if (ctl->met_type == 4) {
7763#ifdef ZSTD
7764 compress_zstd(varname, help, (size_t) (met->np * met->ny * met->nx), 1,
7765 ctl->met_zstd_level, in);
7766#else
7767 ERRMSG("MPTRAC was compiled without ZSTD compression!");
7768#endif
7769 }
7770
7771 /* Read cmultiscale data... */
7772 else if (ctl->met_type == 5) {
7773#ifdef CMS
7774 compress_cms(ctl, varname, help, (size_t) met->nx, (size_t) met->ny,
7775 (size_t) met->np, 1, in);
7776#else
7777 ERRMSG("MPTRAC was compiled without cmultiscale compression!");
7778#endif
7779 }
7780
7781 /* Read SZ3 data... */
7782 else if (ctl->met_type == 7) {
7783#ifdef SZ3
7784 int precision;
7785 FREAD(&precision, int,
7786 1,
7787 in);
7788
7789 double tolerance;
7790 FREAD(&tolerance, double,
7791 1,
7792 in);
7793
7794 compress_sz3(varname, help, met->np, met->ny, met->nx, precision,
7795 tolerance, 1, in);
7796#else
7797 ERRMSG("MPTRAC was compiled without sz3 compression!");
7798#endif
7799 }
7800
7801 /* Copy data... */
7802#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
7803 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
7804 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
7805 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
7806 var[ix][iy][ip] = help[ARRAY_3D(ix, iy, met->ny, ip, met->np)];
7807 if (var[ix][iy][ip] < bound_min)
7808 var[ix][iy][ip] = bound_min;
7809 else if (var[ix][iy][ip] > bound_max)
7810 var[ix][iy][ip] = bound_max;
7811 }
7812
7813 /* Free... */
7814 free(help);
7815}

◆ read_met_cape()

void read_met_cape ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
const clim_t *  clim,
met_t *  met 
)

Calculates Convective Available Potential Energy (CAPE) for each grid point.

This function calculates the Convective Available Potential Energy (CAPE) at each grid point based on the provided meteorological data. CAPE is a measure of the energy available for deep convection, which is essential for severe weather development.

Parameters
climA pointer to a structure containing climatological data.
metA pointer to a structure containing meteorological data.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Sets up a timer to monitor the calculation time.
  • Initializes variables and constants required for the computation, such as vertical spacing and pressure levels.
  • Iterates over each grid point in parallel using OpenMP.
  • Calculates CAPE by integrating the difference in virtual temperatures between the environment and the parcel, up to the level of free convection (LFC).
  • Determines the lifted condensation level (LCL), level of free convection (LFC), equilibrium level (EL), and Convective Inhibition (CIN) for each grid point.
  • Checks the results and updates the corresponding fields in the meteorological data structure.
Note
The function utilizes OpenMP for parallelization to enhance performance by distributing the computation across multiple threads.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7819 of file mptrac.c.

7822 {
7823
7824 /* Check parameters... */
7825 if (ctl->met_cape != 1)
7826 return;
7827
7828 /* Set timer... */
7829 SELECT_TIMER("READ_MET_CAPE", "METPROC", NVTX_READ);
7830 LOG(2, "Calculate CAPE...");
7831
7832 /* Vertical spacing (about 100 m)... */
7833 const double pfac = 1.01439, dz0 = RI / MA / G0 * log(pfac);
7834
7835 /* Loop over columns... */
7836#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
7837 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
7838 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++) {
7839
7840 /* Get potential temperature and water vapor at lowest 50 hPa... */
7841 int n = 0;
7842 double h2o = 0, t, theta = 0;
7843 double pbot = MIN(met->ps[ix][iy], met->p[0]);
7844 double ptop = pbot - 50.;
7845 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
7846 if (met->p[ip] <= pbot) {
7847 theta += THETA(met->p[ip], met->t[ix][iy][ip]);
7848 h2o += met->h2o[ix][iy][ip];
7849 n++;
7850 }
7851 if (met->p[ip] < ptop && n > 0)
7852 break;
7853 }
7854 theta /= n;
7855 h2o /= n;
7856
7857 /* Cannot compute anything if water vapor is missing... */
7858 met->plcl[ix][iy] = NAN;
7859 met->plfc[ix][iy] = NAN;
7860 met->pel[ix][iy] = NAN;
7861 met->cape[ix][iy] = NAN;
7862 met->cin[ix][iy] = NAN;
7863 if (h2o <= 0)
7864 continue;
7865
7866 /* Find lifted condensation level (LCL)... */
7867 ptop = P(20.);
7868 pbot = met->ps[ix][iy];
7869 do {
7870 met->plcl[ix][iy] = (float) (0.5 * (pbot + ptop));
7871 t = theta / pow(1000. / met->plcl[ix][iy], 0.286);
7872 if (RH(met->plcl[ix][iy], t, h2o) > 100.)
7873 ptop = met->plcl[ix][iy];
7874 else
7875 pbot = met->plcl[ix][iy];
7876 } while (pbot - ptop > 0.1);
7877
7878 /* Calculate CIN up to LCL... */
7879 INTPOL_INIT;
7880 double dcape, dz, h2o_env, t_env;
7881 double p = met->ps[ix][iy];
7882 met->cape[ix][iy] = met->cin[ix][iy] = 0;
7883 do {
7884 dz = dz0 * TVIRT(t, h2o);
7885 p /= pfac;
7886 t = theta / pow(1000. / p, 0.286);
7887 intpol_met_space_3d(met, met->t, p, met->lon[ix], met->lat[iy],
7888 &t_env, ci, cw, 1);
7889 intpol_met_space_3d(met, met->h2o, p, met->lon[ix], met->lat[iy],
7890 &h2o_env, ci, cw, 0);
7891 dcape = 1e3 * G0 * (TVIRT(t, h2o) - TVIRT(t_env, h2o_env)) /
7892 TVIRT(t_env, h2o_env) * dz;
7893 if (dcape < 0)
7894 met->cin[ix][iy] += fabsf((float) dcape);
7895 } while (p > met->plcl[ix][iy]);
7896
7897 /* Calculate level of free convection (LFC), equilibrium level (EL),
7898 and convective available potential energy (CAPE)... */
7899 dcape = 0;
7900 p = met->plcl[ix][iy];
7901 t = theta / pow(1000. / p, 0.286);
7902 ptop = 0.75 * clim_tropo(clim, met->time, met->lat[iy]);
7903 do {
7904 dz = dz0 * TVIRT(t, h2o);
7905 p /= pfac;
7906 t -= lapse_rate(t, h2o) * dz;
7907 double psat = PSAT(t);
7908 h2o = psat / (p - (1. - EPS) * psat);
7909 intpol_met_space_3d(met, met->t, p, met->lon[ix], met->lat[iy],
7910 &t_env, ci, cw, 1);
7911 intpol_met_space_3d(met, met->h2o, p, met->lon[ix], met->lat[iy],
7912 &h2o_env, ci, cw, 0);
7913 double dcape_old = dcape;
7914 dcape = 1e3 * G0 * (TVIRT(t, h2o) - TVIRT(t_env, h2o_env)) /
7915 TVIRT(t_env, h2o_env) * dz;
7916 if (dcape > 0) {
7917 met->cape[ix][iy] += (float) dcape;
7918 if (!isfinite(met->plfc[ix][iy]))
7919 met->plfc[ix][iy] = (float) p;
7920 } else if (dcape_old > 0)
7921 met->pel[ix][iy] = (float) p;
7922 if (dcape < 0 && !isfinite(met->plfc[ix][iy]))
7923 met->cin[ix][iy] += fabsf((float) dcape);
7924 } while (p > ptop);
7925
7926 /* Check results... */
7927 if (!isfinite(met->plfc[ix][iy]))
7928 met->cin[ix][iy] = NAN;
7929 }
7930}

double clim_tropo(const clim_t *clim, const double t, const double lat)
Calculates the tropopause pressure based on climatological data.

◆ read_met_cloud()

void read_met_cloud ( met_t *  met)

Calculates cloud-related variables for each grid point.

This function calculates cloud-related variables, such as cloud cover, cloud top pressure, cloud bottom pressure, and total cloud water content, based on the provided meteorological data.

Parameters
metA pointer to a structure containing meteorological data.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Sets up a timer to monitor the calculation time.
  • Initializes variables and constants required for the computation.
  • Iterates over each grid point in parallel using OpenMP.
  • Determines cloud-related variables based on thresholds for liquid water content (LWC), rain water content (RWC), ice water content (IWC) and snow water content (SWC).
  • Calculates cloud cover, cloud top pressure, cloud bottom pressure, and total cloud water content for each grid point.
  • Updates the corresponding fields in the meteorological data structure.
Note
The function utilizes OpenMP for parallelization to enhance performance by distributing the computation across multiple threads.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7934 of file mptrac.c.

7935 {
7936
7937 /* Set timer... */
7938 SELECT_TIMER("READ_MET_CLOUD", "METPROC", NVTX_READ);
7939 LOG(2, "Calculate cloud data...");
7940
7941 /* Thresholds for cloud detection... */
7942 const double ccmin = 0.01, cwmin = 1e-6;
7943
7944 /* Loop over columns... */
7945#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
7946 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
7947 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++) {
7948
7949 /* Init... */
7950 met->pct[ix][iy] = NAN;
7951 met->pcb[ix][iy] = NAN;
7952 met->cl[ix][iy] = 0;
7953
7954 /* Loop over pressure levels... */
7955 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np - 1; ip++) {
7956
7957 /* Check pressure... */
7958 if (met->p[ip] > met->ps[ix][iy] || met->p[ip] < P(20.))
7959 continue;
7960
7961 /* Check ice water and liquid water content... */
7962 if (met->cc[ix][iy][ip] > ccmin
7963 && (met->lwc[ix][iy][ip] > cwmin
7964 || met->rwc[ix][iy][ip] > cwmin
7965 || met->iwc[ix][iy][ip] > cwmin
7966 || met->swc[ix][iy][ip] > cwmin)) {
7967
7968 /* Get cloud top pressure ... */
7969 met->pct[ix][iy]
7970 = (float) (0.5 * (met->p[ip] + (float) met->p[ip + 1]));
7971
7972 /* Get cloud bottom pressure ... */
7973 if (!isfinite(met->pcb[ix][iy]))
7974 met->pcb[ix][iy]
7975 = (float) (0.5 * (met->p[ip] + met->p[MAX(ip - 1, 0)]));
7976 }
7977
7978 /* Get cloud water... */
7979 met->cl[ix][iy] += (float)
7980 (0.5 * (met->lwc[ix][iy][ip] + met->lwc[ix][iy][ip + 1]
7981 + met->rwc[ix][iy][ip] + met->rwc[ix][iy][ip + 1]
7982 + met->iwc[ix][iy][ip] + met->iwc[ix][iy][ip + 1]
7983 + met->swc[ix][iy][ip] + met->swc[ix][iy][ip + 1])
7984 * 100. * (met->p[ip] - met->p[ip + 1]) / G0);
7985 }
7986 }
7987}

◆ read_met_detrend()

void read_met_detrend ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met 
)

Detrends meteorological data.

This function detrends meteorological data by removing spatially varying backgrounds from each grid point. Detrending helps in removing systematic biases and trends from the data, enabling better analysis and modeling.

Parameters
ctlA pointer to a structure containing control parameters.
metA pointer to a structure containing meteorological data.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Checks if detrending is enabled based on the control parameters.
  • Sets up a timer to monitor the detrending time.
  • Allocates memory for a temporary meteorological data structure.
  • Calculates the standard deviation and box size for detrending.
  • Calculates the detrended data by subtracting spatially varying backgrounds.
  • Updates the original meteorological data with the detrended values.
  • Frees the allocated memory.
Note
Detrending is performed by subtracting spatially varying backgrounds calculated from neighboring grid points.
OpenMP is utilized for parallelization to enhance performance by distributing the computation across multiple threads.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 7991 of file mptrac.c.

7993 {
7994
7995 met_t *help;
7996
7997 /* Check parameters... */
7998 if (ctl->met_detrend <= 0)
7999 return;
8000
8001 /* Set timer... */
8002 SELECT_TIMER("READ_MET_DETREND", "METPROC", NVTX_READ);
8003 LOG(2, "Detrend meteo data...");
8004
8005 /* Allocate... */
8006 ALLOC(help, met_t, 1);
8007
8008 /* Calculate standard deviation... */
8009 const double sigma = ctl->met_detrend / 2.355;
8010 const double tssq = 2. * SQR(sigma);
8011
8012 /* Calculate box size in latitude... */
8013 int sy = (int) (3. * DY2DEG(sigma) / fabs(met->lat[1] - met->lat[0]));
8014 sy = MIN(MAX(1, sy), met->ny / 2);
8015
8016 /* Calculate background... */
8017#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
8018 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++) {
8019 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++) {
8020
8021 /* Calculate Cartesian coordinates... */
8022 double x0[3];
8023 geo2cart(0.0, met->lon[ix], met->lat[iy], x0);
8024
8025 /* Calculate box size in longitude... */
8026 int sx =
8027 (int) (3. * DX2DEG(sigma, met->lat[iy]) /
8028 fabs(met->lon[1] - met->lon[0]));
8029 sx = MIN(MAX(1, sx), met->nx / 2);
8030
8031 /* Init... */
8032 float wsum = 0;
8033 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
8034 help->t[ix][iy][ip] = 0;
8035 help->u[ix][iy][ip] = 0;
8036 help->v[ix][iy][ip] = 0;
8037 help->w[ix][iy][ip] = 0;
8038 }
8039
8040 /* Loop over neighboring grid points... */
8041 for (int ix2 = ix - sx; ix2 <= ix + sx; ix2++) {
8042 int ix3 = ix2;
8043 if (ix3 < 0)
8044 ix3 += met->nx;
8045 else if (ix3 >= met->nx)
8046 ix3 -= met->nx;
8047 for (int iy2 = MAX(iy - sy, 0);
8048 iy2 <= MIN(iy + sy, met->ny - 1); iy2++) {
8049
8050 /* Calculate Cartesian coordinates... */
8051 double x1[3];
8052 geo2cart(0.0, met->lon[ix3], met->lat[iy2], x1);
8053
8054 /* Calculate weighting factor... */
8055 const float w = (float) exp(-DIST2(x0, x1) / tssq);
8056
8057 /* Add data... */
8058 wsum += w;
8059 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
8060 help->t[ix][iy][ip] += w * met->t[ix3][iy2][ip];
8061 help->u[ix][iy][ip] += w * met->u[ix3][iy2][ip];
8062 help->v[ix][iy][ip] += w * met->v[ix3][iy2][ip];
8063 help->w[ix][iy][ip] += w * met->w[ix3][iy2][ip];
8064 }
8065 }
8066 }
8067
8068 /* Normalize... */
8069 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
8070 help->t[ix][iy][ip] /= wsum;
8071 help->u[ix][iy][ip] /= wsum;
8072 help->v[ix][iy][ip] /= wsum;
8073 help->w[ix][iy][ip] /= wsum;
8074 }
8075 }
8076 }
8077
8078 /* Subtract background... */
8079#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(3)
8080 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8081 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8082 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
8083 met->t[ix][iy][ip] -= help->t[ix][iy][ip];
8084 met->u[ix][iy][ip] -= help->u[ix][iy][ip];
8085 met->v[ix][iy][ip] -= help->v[ix][iy][ip];
8086 met->w[ix][iy][ip] -= help->w[ix][iy][ip];
8087 }
8088
8089 /* Free... */
8090 free(help);
8091}
geo2cart
void geo2cart(const double z, const double lon, const double lat, double *x)
Converts geographic coordinates (longitude, latitude, altitude) to Cartesian coordinates.
Definition: mptrac.c:1915
DIST2
#define DIST2(a, b)
Calculate the squared Euclidean distance between two points in Cartesian coordinates.
Definition: mptrac.h:661

◆ read_met_extrapolate()

void read_met_extrapolate ( met_t *  met)

Extrapolates meteorological data.

This function extrapolates meteorological data by filling missing or invalid data points with values from the nearest valid point above. Extrapolation is performed column-wise, ensuring that missing data points are replaced with valid values.

Parameters
metA pointer to a structure containing meteorological data.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Sets up a timer to monitor the extrapolation time.
  • Loops over each grid column in parallel.
  • Finds the lowest valid data point within each column.
  • Extrapolates missing or invalid data points by copying values from the nearest valid point above.
  • Updates the meteorological data structure with the extrapolated values.
Note
Extrapolation is performed by copying values from the nearest valid point above to fill missing or invalid data points. OpenMP is utilized for parallelization to enhance performance by distributing the computation across multiple threads.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 8095 of file mptrac.c.

8096 {
8097
8098 /* Set timer... */
8099 SELECT_TIMER("READ_MET_EXTRAPOLATE", "METPROC", NVTX_READ);
8100 LOG(2, "Extrapolate meteo data...");
8101
8102 /* Loop over columns... */
8103#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
8104 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8105 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++) {
8106
8107 /* Find lowest valid data point... */
8108 int ip0;
8109 for (ip0 = met->np - 1; ip0 >= 0; ip0--)
8110 if (!isfinite(met->t[ix][iy][ip0])
8111 || !isfinite(met->u[ix][iy][ip0])
8112 || !isfinite(met->v[ix][iy][ip0])
8113 || !isfinite(met->w[ix][iy][ip0]))
8114 break;
8115
8116 /* Extrapolate... */
8117 for (int ip = ip0; ip >= 0; ip--) {
8118 met->t[ix][iy][ip] = met->t[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8119 met->u[ix][iy][ip] = met->u[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8120 met->v[ix][iy][ip] = met->v[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8121 met->w[ix][iy][ip] = met->w[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8122 met->h2o[ix][iy][ip] = met->h2o[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8123 met->o3[ix][iy][ip] = met->o3[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8124 met->lwc[ix][iy][ip] = met->lwc[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8125 met->rwc[ix][iy][ip] = met->rwc[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8126 met->iwc[ix][iy][ip] = met->iwc[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8127 met->swc[ix][iy][ip] = met->swc[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8128 met->cc[ix][iy][ip] = met->cc[ix][iy][ip + 1];
8129 }
8130 }
8131}

◆ read_met_geopot()

void read_met_geopot ( const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met 
)

Calculates geopotential heights from meteorological data.

This function calculates geopotential heights from provided meteorological data using the hydrostatic equation. Geopotential heights are computed column-wise for each grid point based on the temperature, pressure, and surface height information. Optionally, the calculated geopotential heights can be smoothed horizontally using a weighted averaging scheme.

Parameters
ctlA pointer to a structure containing control parameters.
metA pointer to a structure containing meteorological data.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Sets up a timer to monitor the geopotential height calculation time.
  • Calculates the logarithm of pressure levels for efficient computation.
  • Applies the hydrostatic equation to determine geopotential heights based on temperature, pressure, and height information.
  • Optionally, performs horizontal smoothing on the calculated geopotential heights.
  • Updates the meteorological data structure with the computed geopotential heights.
Note
The hydrostatic equation is utilized to calculate geopotential heights, ensuring consistency with atmospheric conditions. Optionally, horizontal smoothing can be applied to the calculated geopotential heights to reduce spatial variability. OpenMP is utilized for parallelization to enhance performance by distributing the computation across multiple threads.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 8135 of file mptrac.c.

8137 {
8138
8139 float *help;
8140
8141 double logp[EP];
8142
8143 int dx = ctl->met_geopot_sx, dy = ctl->met_geopot_sy;
8144
8145 /* Set timer... */
8146 SELECT_TIMER("READ_MET_GEOPOT", "METPROC", NVTX_READ);
8147 LOG(2, "Calculate geopotential heights...");
8148
8149 /* Allocate... */
8150 ALLOC(help, float,
8151 EX * EY * EP);
8152
8153 /* Calculate log pressure... */
8154#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
8155 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
8156 logp[ip] = log(met->p[ip]);
8157
8158 /* Apply hydrostatic equation to calculate geopotential heights... */
8159#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
8160 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8161 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++) {
8162
8163 /* Get surface height and pressure... */
8164 const double zs = met->zs[ix][iy];
8165 const double lnps = log(met->ps[ix][iy]);
8166
8167 /* Get temperature and water vapor at the surface... */
8168 const int ip0 = locate_irr(met->p, met->np, met->ps[ix][iy]);
8169 const double ts = LIN(met->p[ip0], met->t[ix][iy][ip0], met->p[ip0 + 1],
8170 met->t[ix][iy][ip0 + 1], met->ps[ix][iy]);
8171 const double h2os =
8172 LIN(met->p[ip0], met->h2o[ix][iy][ip0], met->p[ip0 + 1],
8173 met->h2o[ix][iy][ip0 + 1], met->ps[ix][iy]);
8174
8175 /* Upper part of profile... */
8176 met->z[ix][iy][ip0 + 1]
8177 = (float) (zs +
8178 ZDIFF(lnps, ts, h2os, logp[ip0 + 1],
8179 met->t[ix][iy][ip0 + 1], met->h2o[ix][iy][ip0 + 1]));
8180 for (int ip = ip0 + 2; ip < met->np; ip++)
8181 met->z[ix][iy][ip]
8182 = (float) (met->z[ix][iy][ip - 1] +
8183 ZDIFF(logp[ip - 1], met->t[ix][iy][ip - 1],
8184 met->h2o[ix][iy][ip - 1], logp[ip],
8185 met->t[ix][iy][ip], met->h2o[ix][iy][ip]));
8186
8187 /* Lower part of profile... */
8188 met->z[ix][iy][ip0]
8189 = (float) (zs +
8190 ZDIFF(lnps, ts, h2os, logp[ip0],
8191 met->t[ix][iy][ip0], met->h2o[ix][iy][ip0]));
8192 for (int ip = ip0 - 1; ip >= 0; ip--)
8193 met->z[ix][iy][ip]
8194 = (float) (met->z[ix][iy][ip + 1] +
8195 ZDIFF(logp[ip + 1], met->t[ix][iy][ip + 1],
8196 met->h2o[ix][iy][ip + 1], logp[ip],
8197 met->t[ix][iy][ip], met->h2o[ix][iy][ip]));
8198 }
8199
8200 /* Check control parameters... */
8201 if (dx == 0 || dy == 0)
8202 return;
8203
8204 /* Default smoothing parameters... */
8205 if (dx < 0 || dy < 0) {
8206 if (fabs(met->lon[1] - met->lon[0]) < 0.5) {
8207 dx = 3;
8208 dy = 2;
8209 } else {
8210 dx = 6;
8211 dy = 4;
8212 }
8213 }
8214
8215 /* Calculate weights for smoothing... */
8216 float ws[dx + 1][dy + 1];
8217#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
8218 for (int ix = 0; ix <= dx; ix++)
8219 for (int iy = 0; iy < dy; iy++)
8220 ws[ix][iy] = (1.0f - (float) ix / (float) dx)
8221 * (1.0f - (float) iy / (float) dy);
8222
8223 /* Copy data... */
8224#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(3)
8225 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8226 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8227 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
8228 help[ARRAY_3D(ip, ix, met->nx, iy, met->ny)] = met->z[ix][iy][ip];
8229
8230 /* Horizontal smoothing... */
8231#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(3)
8232 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
8233 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8234 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++) {
8235 float res = 0, wsum = 0;
8236 int iy0 = MAX(iy - dy + 1, 0);
8237 int iy1 = MIN(iy + dy - 1, met->ny - 1);
8238 for (int ix2 = ix - dx + 1; ix2 <= ix + dx - 1; ++ix2) {
8239 int ix3 = ix2;
8240 if (ix3 < 0)
8241 ix3 += met->nx;
8242 else if (ix3 >= met->nx)
8243 ix3 -= met->nx;
8244 for (int iy2 = iy0; iy2 <= iy1; ++iy2)
8245 if (isfinite(help[ARRAY_3D(ip, ix3, met->nx, iy2, met->ny)])) {
8246 float w = ws[abs(ix - ix2)][abs(iy - iy2)];
8247 res += w * help[ARRAY_3D(ip, ix3, met->nx, iy2, met->ny)];
8248 wsum += w;
8249 }
8250 }
8251 if (wsum > 0)
8252 met->z[ix][iy][ip] = res / wsum;
8253 else
8254 met->z[ix][iy][ip] = NAN;
8255 }
8256
8257 /* Free... */
8258 free(help);
8259}
ZDIFF
#define ZDIFF(lnp0, t0, h2o0, lnp1, t1, h2o1)
Calculate geopotential height difference.
Definition: mptrac.h:1889
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ read_met_nc_grid()

void read_met_nc_grid ( const char *  filename,
const int  ncid,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met,
dd_t *  dd 
)

Reads meteorological grid data from NetCDF files with domain decomposition.

The read_met_nc_grid function reads meteorological data from NetCDF files and processes it with domain decomposition for parallel processing. It extracts time information, grid dimensions, and coordinates, and sets up hyperslabs for subdomains and halos. It also reads pressure levels and handles model level and surface data.

Parameters
filenameA string representing the filename of the NetCDF file to read.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure containing control parameters.
metA pointer to a met_t structure where meteorological data will be stored.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Sets filenames for meteorological data files.
  • Extracts time information from the filename or NetCDF file.
  • Validates the time information and logs it.
  • Retrieves global and local grid dimensions and checks for regular grid spacing.
  • Sets up hyperslabs for subdomains and halos, considering edge cases.
  • Adjusts grid dimensions and coordinates for subdomains and halos.
  • Reads pressure levels and computes the 3D pressure field.
  • Handles model level and surface data using GRIB handles.
  • Reads grid data and surface data from the respective files.
  • Computes the 3D pressure field and reads model level data.
Note
This function assumes that the input filename and structures are properly initialized. It uses MPI for parallel processing and handles domain decomposition. The function is designed to work with NetCDF and GRIB file formats. It logs various stages of processing for debugging and validation purposes.
Author
Lars Hoffmann
Jan Clemens

Definition at line 8263 of file mptrac.c.

8285

8288

8290 jsec2time(met->time, &year, &mon, &day, &hour, &min, &sec, &r);

8292 NC(nc_get_var_double(ncid, varid, &rtime));
8293 if (fabs(year * 10000. + mon * 100. + day + hour / 24. - rtime) > 1.0)
8294 WARN("Time information in meteo file does not match filename!");
8295 } else
8296 WARN("Time information in meteo file is missing!");
8297 }
8298
8299 /* CLaMS meteo files... */
8300 else {
8301
8302 /* Read time from file... */
8303 NC_GET_DOUBLE("time", &rtime, 0);
8304
8305 /* Get time from filename (considering the century)... */
8306 if (rtime < 0)
8307 sprintf(tstr, "19%.2s", &filename[strlen(filename) - 11]);
8308 else
8309 sprintf(tstr, "20%.2s", &filename[strlen(filename) - 11]);
8310 year = atoi(tstr);
8311 sprintf(tstr, "%.2s", &filename[strlen(filename) - 9]);
8312 mon = atoi(tstr);
8313 sprintf(tstr, "%.2s", &filename[strlen(filename) - 7]);
8314 day = atoi(tstr);
8315 sprintf(tstr, "%.2s", &filename[strlen(filename) - 5]);
8316 hour = atoi(tstr);
8317 time2jsec(year, mon, day, hour, 0, 0, 0, &met->time);
8318 }
8319
8320 /* Check time... */
8321 if (year < 1900 || year > 2100 || mon < 1 || mon > 12
8322 || day < 1 || day > 31 || hour < 0 || hour > 23)
8323 ERRMSG("Cannot read time from filename!");
8324 jsec2time(met->time, &year2, &mon2, &day2, &hour2, &min2, &sec2, &r2);
8325 LOG(2, "Time: %.2f (%d-%02d-%02d, %02d:%02d UTC)",
8326 met->time, year2, mon2, day2, hour2, min2);
8327
8328 /* Get vertical dimension... */
8329 if (nc_inq_varid(ncid, "u", &varid) != NC_NOERR)
8330 if (nc_inq_varid(ncid, "U", &varid) != NC_NOERR)
8331 ERRMSG
8332 ("Variable 'u' or 'U' not found, cannot determine vertical dimension!");
8333
8334 NC(nc_inq_varndims(ncid, varid, &ndims));
8335 NC(nc_inq_vardimid(ncid, varid, dimids));
8336
8337 if (ndims == 4) {
8338 NC(nc_inq_dim
8339 (ncid, dimids[ctl->met_convention == 0 ? 1 : 3], levname, &dimlen));
8340 } else if (ndims == 3) {
8341 NC(nc_inq_dim
8342 (ncid, dimids[ctl->met_convention == 0 ? 0 : 2], levname, &dimlen));
8343 } else
8344 ERRMSG("Cannot determine vertical dimension!")
8345 met->np = (int) dimlen;
8346
8347 LOG(2, "Number of levels: %d", met->np);
8348 if (met->np < 2 || met->np > EP)
8349 ERRMSG("Number of levels out of range!");
8350
8351 if (!ctl->dd) {
8352
8353 /* Get grid dimensions... */
8354 NC_INQ_DIM("lon", &met->nx, 2, EX, 1);
8355 LOG(2, "Number of longitudes: %d", met->nx);
8356
8357 NC_INQ_DIM("lat", &met->ny, 2, EY, 1);
8358 LOG(2, "Number of latitudes: %d", met->ny);
8359
8360 /* Read longitudes and latitudes... */
8361 NC_GET_DOUBLE("lon", met->lon, 1);
8362 LOG(2, "Longitudes: %g, %g ... %g deg",
8363 met->lon[0], met->lon[1], met->lon[met->nx - 1]);
8364 NC_GET_DOUBLE("lat", met->lat, 1);
8365 LOG(2, "Latitudes: %g, %g ... %g deg",
8366 met->lat[0], met->lat[1], met->lat[met->ny - 1]);
8367
8368 } else {
8369
8370 /* Use 'naive', i.e. equidistant lat-lon domain decomposition... */
8371 read_met_nc_grid_dd_naive(dd, ctl, met, ncid);
8372
8373 }
8374
8375 /* Read pressure levels... */
8376 if (ctl->met_np <= 0) {
8377 NC_GET_DOUBLE(levname, met->p, 1);
8378 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
8379 met->p[ip] /= 100.;
8380 LOG(2, "Altitude levels: %g, %g ... %g km",
8381 Z(met->p[0]), Z(met->p[1]), Z(met->p[met->np - 1]));
8382 LOG(2, "Pressure levels: %g, %g ... %g hPa",
8383 met->p[0], met->p[1], met->p[met->np - 1]);
8384 }
8385
8386 /* Read hybrid levels... */
8387 if (strcasecmp(levname, "hybrid") == 0)
8388 NC_GET_DOUBLE("hybrid", met->hybrid, 1);
8389
8390 /* Check grid spacing... */
8391 for (int ix = 2; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8392 if (fabs
8393 (fabs(met->lon[ix] - met->lon[ix - 1]) -
8394 fabs(met->lon[1] - met->lon[0])) > 0.001)
8395 ERRMSG("No regular grid spacing in longitudes!");
8396 for (int iy = 2; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8397 if (fabs
8398 (fabs(met->lat[iy] - met->lat[iy - 1]) -
8399 fabs(met->lat[1] - met->lat[0])) > 0.001) {
8400 WARN("No regular grid spacing in latitudes!");
8401 break;
8402 }
8403}

◆ read_met_nc_surface()

void read_met_nc_surface ( const int  ncid,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met,
dd_t *  dd 
)

Reads and processes surface meteorological data from NetCDF files with domain decomposition.

The read_met_nc_surface function reads surface meteorological data from a NetCDF file and processes it for use in a domain decomposition context. It handles various surface parameters such as pressure, geopotential height, temperature, wind components, and other relevant meteorological data. The function is designed to work with different meteorological data formats and configurations.

Parameters
ncidAn integer representing the NetCDF file ID.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure containing control parameters and settings.
metA pointer to a met_t structure where surface meteorological data will be stored.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Reads surface pressure data and converts it if necessary.
  • Handles different data formats for MPTRAC and CLaMS meteorological data.
  • Reads geopotential height at the surface and processes it based on the data format.
  • Retrieves surface temperature, zonal and meridional wind, and other surface parameters.
  • Logs warnings if specific data fields cannot be read.
  • Uses helper functions to read 2D and 3D data fields from the NetCDF file.
  • Processes and stores the read data into the provided meteorological data structure.
Note
This function assumes that the NetCDF file ID and structures are properly initialized. It is designed to work with NetCDF files and uses MPI for parallel processing. The function logs warnings for missing or unreadable data fields and handles different data formats.
Author
Lars Hoffmann
Jan Clemens

Definition at line 8407 of file mptrac.c.

8411 {
8412
8413 /* Set timer... */
8414 SELECT_TIMER("READ_MET_SURFACE", "INPUT", NVTX_READ);
8415 LOG(2, "Read surface data...");
8416
8417 /* Read surface pressure... */
8418 if (read_met_nc_2d
8419 (ncid, "lnsp", "LNSP", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->ps,
8420 1.0f, 1)) {
8421 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8422 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8423 met->ps[ix][iy] = (float) (exp(met->ps[ix][iy]) / 100.);
8424 } else
8425 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8426 (ncid, "ps", "PS", "sp", "SP", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->ps,
8427 0.01f, 1)) {
8428 WARN("Cannot not read surface pressure data (use lowest level)!");
8429 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8430 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8431 met->ps[ix][iy]
8432 = (ctl->met_np > 0 ? (float) ctl->met_p[0] : (float) met->p[0]);
8433 }
8434
8435 /* MPTRAC meteo data... */
8436 if (ctl->met_clams == 0) {
8437
8438 /* Read geopotential height at the surface... */
8439 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8440 (ncid, "z", "Z", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->zs,
8441 (float) (1. / (1000. * G0)), 1))
8442 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8443 (ncid, "zm", "ZM", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->zs,
8444 (float) (1. / 1000.), 1))
8445 WARN("Cannot read surface geopotential height!");
8446 }
8447
8448 /* CLaMS meteo data... */
8449 else {
8450
8451 /* Read geopotential height at the surface
8452 (use lowermost level of 3-D data field)... */
8453 float *help;
8454 ALLOC(help, float,
8455 EX * EY * EP);
8456 memcpy(help, met->pl, sizeof(met->pl));
8457 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8458 (ncid, "gph", "GPH", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->pl,
8459 (float) (1e-3 / G0)))
8460 ERRMSG("Cannot read geopotential height!");
8461 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8462 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8463 met->zs[ix][iy] = met->pl[ix][iy][0];
8464 memcpy(met->pl, help, sizeof(met->pl));
8465 free(help);
8466 }
8467
8468 /* Read temperature at the surface... */
8469 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8470 (ncid, "t2m", "T2M", "2t", "2T", "t2", "T2", ctl, met, dd, met->ts, 1.0,
8471 1))
8472 WARN("Cannot read surface temperature!");
8473
8474 /* Read zonal wind at the surface... */
8475 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8476 (ncid, "u10m", "U10M", "10u", "10U", "u10", "U10", ctl, met, dd,
8477 met->us, 1.0, 1))
8478 WARN("Cannot read surface zonal wind!");
8479
8480 /* Read meridional wind at the surface... */
8481 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8482 (ncid, "v10m", "V10M", "10v", "10V", "v10", "V10", ctl, met, dd,
8483 met->vs, 1.0, 1))
8484 WARN("Cannot read surface meridional wind!");
8485
8486 /* Read eastward turbulent surface stress... */
8487 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8488 (ncid, "iews", "IEWS", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->ess,
8489 1.0, 1))
8490 WARN("Cannot read eastward turbulent surface stress!");
8491
8492 /* Read northward turbulent surface stress... */
8493 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8494 (ncid, "inss", "INSS", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->nss,
8495 1.0, 1))
8496 WARN("Cannot read nothward turbulent surface stress!");
8497
8498 /* Read surface sensible heat flux... */
8499 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8500 (ncid, "ishf", "ISHF", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->shf,
8501 1.0, 1))
8502 WARN("Cannot read surface sensible heat flux!");
8503
8504 /* Read land-sea mask... */
8505 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8506 (ncid, "lsm", "LSM", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->lsm,
8507 1.0, 1))
8508 WARN("Cannot read land-sea mask!");
8509
8510 /* Read sea surface temperature... */
8511 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8512 (ncid, "sstk", "SSTK", "sst", "SST", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->sst,
8513 1.0, 1))
8514 WARN("Cannot read sea surface temperature!");
8515
8516 /* Read PBL... */
8517 if (ctl->met_pbl == 0)
8518 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8519 (ncid, "blp", "BLP", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->pbl,
8520 0.01f, 1))
8521 WARN("Cannot read planetary boundary layer pressure!");
8522 if (ctl->met_pbl == 1)
8523 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8524 (ncid, "blh", "BLH", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->pbl,
8525 0.001f, 1))
8526 WARN("Cannot read planetary boundary layer height!");
8527
8528 /* Read CAPE... */
8529 if (ctl->met_cape == 0)
8530 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8531 (ncid, "cape", "CAPE", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd,
8532 met->cape, 1.0, 1))
8533 WARN("Cannot read CAPE!");
8534
8535 /* Read CIN... */
8536 if (ctl->met_cape == 0)
8537 if (!read_met_nc_2d
8538 (ncid, "cin", "CIN", NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->cin,
8539 1.0, 1))
8540 WARN("Cannot read convective inhibition!");
8541}

◆ read_met_nc_levels()

void read_met_nc_levels ( const int  ncid,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met,
dd_t *  dd 
)

Reads and processes meteorological level data from NetCDF files with domain decomposition.

The read_met_nc_levels function reads meteorological level data from a NetCDF file and processes it for use in a domain decomposition context. It handles various meteorological parameters such as temperature, wind components, humidity, ozone, cloud data, and vertical velocity. The function also processes pressure levels and interpolates data between model and pressure levels as needed.

Parameters
ncidAn integer representing the NetCDF file ID.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure containing control parameters and settings.
metA pointer to a met_t structure where meteorological level data will be stored.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Reads temperature, horizontal wind components, and vertical velocity data.
  • Processes water vapor data, handling both specific and relative humidity.
  • Reads ozone and various cloud-related data such as liquid water content, ice water content, and cloud cover.
  • Processes zeta and zeta_dot data.
  • Stores velocities on model levels and saves the number of model levels.
  • Computes pressure on model levels using different methods based on control parameters.
  • Checks the ordering of pressure levels to ensure they are monotonic.
  • Interpolates meteorological variables from model levels to pressure levels if specified.
  • Validates the ordering of pressure levels to ensure they are in descending order.
Note
This function assumes that the NetCDF file ID and structures are properly initialized. It is designed to work with NetCDF files and uses OpenMP for parallel processing. The function logs errors and warnings for missing or unreadable data fields and handles different data formats.
Author
Lars Hoffmann
Jan Clemens

Definition at line 8545 of file mptrac.c.

8549 {
8550
8551 /* Set timer... */
8552 SELECT_TIMER("READ_MET_NC_LEVELS", "INPUT", NVTX_READ);
8553 LOG(2, "Read level data...");
8554
8555 /* Read temperature... */
8556 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8557 (ncid, "t", "T", "temp", "TEMP", ctl, met, dd, met->t, 1.0))
8558 ERRMSG("Cannot read temperature!");
8559
8560 /* Read horizontal wind and vertical velocity... */
8561 if (!read_met_nc_3d(ncid, "u", "U", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->u, 1.0))
8562 ERRMSG("Cannot read zonal wind!");
8563 if (!read_met_nc_3d(ncid, "v", "V", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->v, 1.0))
8564 ERRMSG("Cannot read meridional wind!");
8565 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8566 (ncid, "w", "W", "omega", "OMEGA", ctl, met, dd, met->w, 0.01f))
8567 WARN("Cannot read vertical velocity!");
8568
8569 /* Read water vapor... */
8570 if (!ctl->met_relhum) {
8571 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8572 (ncid, "q", "Q", "sh", "SH", ctl, met, dd, met->h2o,
8573 (float) (MA / MH2O)))
8574 WARN("Cannot read specific humidity!");
8575 } else {
8576 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8577 (ncid, "rh", "RH", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->h2o, 0.01f))
8578 WARN("Cannot read relative humidity!");
8579#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
8580 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8581 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8582 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
8583 double pw = met->h2o[ix][iy][ip] * PSAT(met->t[ix][iy][ip]);
8584 met->h2o[ix][iy][ip] =
8585 (float) (pw / (met->p[ip] - (1.0 - EPS) * pw));
8586 }
8587 }
8588
8589 /* Read ozone... */
8590 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8591 (ncid, "o3", "O3", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->o3,
8592 (float) (MA / MO3)))
8593 WARN("Cannot read ozone data!");
8594
8595 /* Read cloud data... */
8596 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8597 (ncid, "clwc", "CLWC", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->lwc, 1.0))
8598 WARN("Cannot read cloud liquid water content!");
8599 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8600 (ncid, "crwc", "CRWC", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->rwc, 1.0))
8601 WARN("Cannot read cloud rain water content!");
8602 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8603 (ncid, "ciwc", "CIWC", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->iwc, 1.0))
8604 WARN("Cannot read cloud ice water content!");
8605 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8606 (ncid, "cswc", "CSWC", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->swc, 1.0))
8607 WARN("Cannot read cloud snow water content!");
8608 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8609 (ncid, "cc", "CC", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->cc, 1.0))
8610 WARN("Cannot read cloud cover!");
8611
8612 /* Read zeta and zeta_dot... */
8613 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8614 (ncid, "ZETA", "zeta", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->zetal, 1.0))
8615 WARN("Cannot read ZETA!");
8616 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8617 (ncid, "ZETA_DOT_TOT", "ZETA_DOT_clr", "zeta_dot_clr",
8618 NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->zeta_dotl, 0.00001157407f))
8619 WARN("Cannot read ZETA_DOT!");
8620
8621 /* Store velocities on model levels... */
8622 if (ctl->met_vert_coord != 0) {
8623#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
8624 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8625 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8626 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
8627 met->ul[ix][iy][ip] = met->u[ix][iy][ip];
8628 met->vl[ix][iy][ip] = met->v[ix][iy][ip];
8629 met->wl[ix][iy][ip] = met->w[ix][iy][ip];
8630 }
8631
8632 /* Save number of model levels... */
8633 met->npl = met->np;
8634 }
8635
8636 /* Get pressure on model levels... */
8637 if (ctl->met_np > 0 || ctl->met_vert_coord != 0) {
8638
8639 /* Read 3-D pressure field... */
8640 if (ctl->met_vert_coord == 1) {
8641 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8642 (ncid, "pl", "PL", "pressure", "PRESSURE", ctl, met, dd, met->pl,
8643 0.01f))
8644 if (!read_met_nc_3d
8645 (ncid, "press", "PRESS", NULL, NULL, ctl, met, dd, met->pl, 1.0))
8646 ERRMSG("Cannot read pressure on model levels!");
8647
8648 }
8649
8650 /* Use a and b coefficients for full levels... */
8651 else if (ctl->met_vert_coord == 2 || ctl->met_vert_coord == 3) {
8652
8653 /* Grid level coefficients... */
8654 double hyam[EP], hybm[EP];
8655
8656 /* Read coefficients... */
8657 if (ctl->met_vert_coord == 2) {
8658 int varid;
8659 NC_GET_DOUBLE("hyam", hyam, 1);
8660 NC_GET_DOUBLE("hybm", hybm, 1);
8661 }
8662
8663 /* Use control parameters... */
8664 else if (ctl->met_vert_coord == 3) {
8665
8666 /* Check number of levels... */
8667 if (met->np != ctl->met_nlev)
8668 ERRMSG("Mismatch in number of model levels!");
8669
8670 /* Copy parameters... */
8671 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
8672 hyam[ip] = ctl->met_lev_hyam[ip];
8673 hybm[ip] = ctl->met_lev_hybm[ip];
8674 }
8675 }
8676
8677 /* Calculate pressure... */
8678 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8679 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8680 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
8681 met->pl[ix][iy][ip] =
8682 (float) (hyam[ip] / 100. + hybm[ip] * met->ps[ix][iy]);
8683
8684 }
8685
8686 /* Use a and b coefficients for half levels... */
8687 else if (ctl->met_vert_coord == 4) {
8688
8689 /* Grid level coefficients... */
8690 double hyam[EP], hybm[EP];
8691
8692 /* Use control parameters... */
8693 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np + 1; ip++) {
8694 hyam[ip] = ctl->met_lev_hyam[ip];
8695 hybm[ip] = ctl->met_lev_hybm[ip];
8696 }
8697
8698 /* Check number of levels... */
8699 if (met->np + 1 != ctl->met_nlev)
8700 ERRMSG("Mismatch in number of model levels!");
8701
8702 /* Calculate pressure... */
8703#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
8704 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8705 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8706 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++) {
8707 const double p0 = hyam[ip] / 100. + hybm[ip] * met->ps[ix][iy];
8708 const double p1 =
8709 hyam[ip + 1] / 100. + hybm[ip + 1] * met->ps[ix][iy];
8710 met->pl[ix][iy][ip] = (float) ((p1 - p0) / log(p1 / p0));
8711 }
8712 }
8713
8714 /* Check ordering of pressure levels... */
8715 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8716 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8717 for (int ip = 1; ip < met->np; ip++)
8718 if ((met->pl[ix][iy][0] > met->pl[ix][iy][1]
8719 && met->pl[ix][iy][ip - 1] <= met->pl[ix][iy][ip])
8720 || (met->pl[ix][iy][0] < met->pl[ix][iy][1]
8721 && met->pl[ix][iy][ip - 1] >= met->pl[ix][iy][ip]))
8722 ERRMSG("Pressure profiles are not monotonic!");
8723 }
8724
8725 /* Interpolate from model levels to pressure levels... */
8726 if (ctl->met_np > 0) {
8727
8728 /* Interpolate variables... */
8729 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->t, "T");
8730 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->u, "U");
8731 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->v, "V");
8732 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->w, "W");
8733 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->h2o, "H2O");
8734 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->o3, "O3");
8735 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->lwc, "LWC");
8736 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->rwc, "RWC");
8737 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->iwc, "IWC");
8738 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->swc, "SWC");
8739 read_met_ml2pl(ctl, met, met->cc, "CC");
8740
8741 /* Set new pressure levels... */
8742 met->np = ctl->met_np;
8743 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
8744 met->p[ip] = ctl->met_p[ip];
8745 }
8746
8747 /* Check ordering of pressure levels... */
8748 for (int ip = 1; ip < met->np; ip++)
8749 if (met->p[ip - 1] < met->p[ip])
8750 ERRMSG("Pressure levels must be descending!");
8751
8752}
read_met_ml2pl

Interpolates meteorological data to specified pressure levels.

#define MO3

◆ read_met_nc_2d()

int read_met_nc_2d ( const int  ncid,
const char *  varname,
const char *  varname2,
const char *  varname3,
const char *  varname4,
const char *  varname5,
const char *  varname6,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
const met_t *  met,
dd_t *  dd,
float  dest[EX][EY],
const float  scl,
const int  init 
)

Reads a 2-dimensional meteorological variable from a NetCDF file.

This function reads a 2-dimensional meteorological variable from a NetCDF file and stores it in a specified destination array. It supports both packed and unpacked data formats and handles missing values and scaling factors accordingly. The function also checks the meteorological data layout to ensure correct data copying.

Parameters
ncidThe NetCDF file ID.
varnameThe name of the variable to read.
varname2An alternative name of the variable to read (in case varname is not found).
varname3An alternative name of the variable to read (in case varname2 is not found).
varname4An alternative name of the variable to read (in case varname3 is not found).
ctlA pointer to a structure containing control parameters.
metA pointer to a structure containing meteorological data.
destThe destination array to store the read data.
sclA scaling factor to apply to the read data.
initFlag indicating whether to initialize the destination array before reading.
Returns
Returns 1 on success, 0 on failure.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Checks if the specified variable exists in the NetCDF file.
  • Reads packed data if scaling factors are available, otherwise reads unpacked data.
  • Handles missing values and scaling factors appropriately.
  • Copies the data to the destination array, applying the scaling factor if provided.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 8756 of file mptrac.c.

8776
8777 /* Check if variable exists... */
8778 if (nc_inq_varid(ncid, varname, &varid) == NC_NOERR)
8779 sprintf(varsel, "%s", varname);
8780 else if (varname2 != NULL

8792 else if (varname6 != NULL

8794 sprintf(varsel, "%s", varname6);
8795 else
8796 return 0;
8797
8798 /* Read packed data... */
8799 if (ctl->met_nc_scale && !ctl->dd
8800 && nc_get_att_float(ncid, varid, "add_offset", &offset) == NC_NOERR
8801 && nc_get_att_float(ncid, varid, "scale_factor",
8802 &scalfac) == NC_NOERR) {
8803
8804 /* Allocate... */
8805 short *help;
8806 ALLOC(help, short,
8807 EX * EY * EP);
8808
8809 /* Read fill value and missing value... */
8810 short fillval, missval;
8811 if (nc_get_att_short(ncid, varid, "_FillValue", &fillval) != NC_NOERR)
8812 fillval = 0;
8813 if (nc_get_att_short(ncid, varid, "missing_value", &missval) != NC_NOERR)
8814 missval = 0;
8815
8816 /* Write info... */
8817 LOG(2, "Read 2-D variable: %s"
8818 " (FILL = %d, MISS = %d, SCALE = %g, OFFSET = %g)",
8819 varsel, fillval, missval, scalfac, offset);
8820
8821 /* Read data... */
8822 NC(nc_get_var_short(ncid, varid, help));
8823
8824 /* Check meteo data layout... */
8825 if (ctl->met_convention != 0)
8826 ERRMSG("Meteo data layout not implemented for packed netCDF files!");
8827
8828 /* Copy and check data... */
8829 omp_set_dynamic(1);
8830#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
8831 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8832 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++) {
8833 if (init)
8834 dest[ix][iy] = 0;
8835 const short aux = help[ARRAY_2D(iy, ix, met->nx)];
8836 if ((fillval == 0 || aux != fillval)
8837 && (missval == 0 || aux != missval)
8838 && fabsf(aux * scalfac + offset) < 1e14f)
8839 dest[ix][iy] += scl * (aux * scalfac + offset);
8840 else
8841 dest[ix][iy] = NAN;
8842 }
8843 omp_set_dynamic(0);
8844
8845 /* Free... */
8846 free(help);
8847 }
8848
8849 /* Unpacked data... */
8850 else if (!ctl->dd) {
8851
8852 /* Allocate... */
8853 float *help;
8854 ALLOC(help, float,
8855 EX * EY);
8856
8857 /* Read fill value and missing value... */
8858 float fillval, missval;
8859 if (nc_get_att_float(ncid, varid, "_FillValue", &fillval) != NC_NOERR)
8860 fillval = 0;
8861 if (nc_get_att_float(ncid, varid, "missing_value", &missval) != NC_NOERR)
8862 missval = 0;
8863
8864 /* Write info... */
8865 LOG(2, "Read 2-D variable: %s (FILL = %g, MISS = %g)",
8866 varsel, fillval, missval);
8867
8868 /* Read data... */
8869 NC(nc_get_var_float(ncid, varid, help));
8870
8871 /* Check meteo data layout... */
8872 if (ctl->met_convention == 0) {
8873
8874 /* Copy and check data (ordering: lat, lon)... */
8875 omp_set_dynamic(1);
8876#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
8877 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
8878 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++) {
8879 if (init)
8880 dest[ix][iy] = 0;
8881 const float aux = help[ARRAY_2D(iy, ix, met->nx)];
8882 if ((fillval == 0 || aux != fillval)
8883 && (missval == 0 || aux != missval)
8884 && fabsf(aux) < 1e14f)
8885 dest[ix][iy] += scl * aux;
8886 else
8887 dest[ix][iy] = NAN;
8888 }
8889 omp_set_dynamic(0);
8890
8891 } else {
8892
8893 /* Copy and check data (ordering: lon, lat)... */
8894 omp_set_dynamic(1);
8895#pragma omp parallel for default(shared)
8896 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
8897 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++) {
8898 if (init)
8899 dest[ix][iy] = 0;
8900 const float aux = help[ARRAY_2D(ix, iy, met->ny)];
8901 if ((fillval == 0 || aux != fillval)
8902 && (missval == 0 || aux != missval)
8903 && fabsf(aux) < 1e14f)
8904 dest[ix][iy] += scl * aux;
8905 else
8906 dest[ix][iy] = NAN;
8907 }
8908 omp_set_dynamic(0);
8909 }
8910
8911 /* Free... */
8912 free(help);
8913
8914 }
8915 /* Domain decomposed data... */
8916 else {
8917
8918 /* Read fill value and missing value... */
8919 float fillval, missval;
8920 if (nc_get_att_float(ncid, varid, "_FillValue", &fillval) != NC_NOERR)
8921 fillval = 0;
8922 if (nc_get_att_float(ncid, varid, "missing_value", &missval) != NC_NOERR)
8923 missval = 0;
8924
8925 /* Write info... */
8926 LOG(2, "Read 2-D variable: %s (FILL = %g, MISS = %g)",
8927 varsel, fillval, missval);
8928
8929 /* Define hyperslab... */
8930 float *help;
8931 size_t help_subdomain_start[3];
8932 size_t help_subdomain_count[3];
8933
8934 help_subdomain_start[0] = 0;
8935 help_subdomain_start[1] = dd->subdomain_start[2];
8936 help_subdomain_start[2] = dd->subdomain_start[3];
8937
8938 help_subdomain_count[0] = 1;
8939 help_subdomain_count[1] = dd->subdomain_count[2]; //y
8940 help_subdomain_count[2] = dd->subdomain_count[3]; //x
8941
8942 ALLOC(help, float,
8943 (int) dd->subdomain_count[2] * (int) dd->subdomain_count[3]
8944 );
8945
8946 /* Read data... */
8947 NC(nc_get_vara_float
8948 (ncid, varid, help_subdomain_start, help_subdomain_count, help));
8949
8950 /* Read halos at boundaries... */
8951 size_t help_halo_bnd_start[3];
8952 size_t help_halo_bnd_count[3];
8953
8954 help_halo_bnd_start[0] = 0;
8955 help_halo_bnd_start[1] = dd->halo_bnd_start[2];
8956 help_halo_bnd_start[2] = dd->halo_bnd_start[3];
8957
8958 help_halo_bnd_count[0] = 1;
8959 help_halo_bnd_count[1] = dd->halo_bnd_count[2]; //y
8960 help_halo_bnd_count[2] = dd->halo_bnd_count[3]; //x
8961
8962 float *help_halo;
8963 ALLOC(help_halo, float,
8964 help_halo_bnd_count[1] * help_halo_bnd_count[2]);
8965 NC(nc_get_vara_float
8966 (ncid, varid, help_halo_bnd_start, help_halo_bnd_count, help_halo));
8967
8968 /* Check meteo data layout... */
8969 if (ctl->met_convention == 0) {
8970 /* Copy and check data (ordering: lat, lon)... */
8971#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) num_threads(12)
8972 for (int ix = 0; ix < (int) help_subdomain_count[2]; ix++)
8973 for (int iy = 0; iy < (int) help_subdomain_count[1]; iy++) {
8974 if (init == 1)
8975 dest[ix + dd->halo_offset_start][iy] = 0;
8976 const float aux =
8977 help[ARRAY_2D(iy, ix, (int) help_subdomain_count[2])];
8978 if ((fillval == 0 || aux != fillval)
8979 && (missval == 0 || aux != missval)
8980 && fabsf(aux) < 1e14f) {
8981 dest[ix + dd->halo_offset_start][iy] += scl * aux;
8982 } else
8983 dest[ix + dd->halo_offset_start][iy] = NAN;
8984 }
8985
8986 /* Copy and check data (ordering: lat, lon)... */
8987#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) num_threads(12)
8988 for (int ix = 0; ix < (int) help_halo_bnd_count[2]; ix++)
8989 for (int iy = 0; iy < (int) help_halo_bnd_count[1]; iy++) {
8990 if (init == 1)
8991 dest[ix + dd->halo_offset_end][iy] = 0;
8992 const float aux =
8993 help_halo[ARRAY_2D(iy, ix, (int) help_halo_bnd_count[2])];
8994 if ((fillval == 0 || aux != fillval)
8995 && (missval == 0 || aux != missval)
8996 && fabsf(aux) < 1e14f)
8997 dest[ix + dd->halo_offset_end][iy] += scl * aux;
8998 else {
8999 dest[ix + dd->halo_offset_end][iy] = NAN;
9000 }
9001 }
9002
9003 } else {
9004 ERRMSG("Domain decomposition with data convection incompatible!");
9005 }
9006
9007 /* Free... */
9008 free(help);
9009 free(help_halo);
9010 }
9011
9012 /* Return... */
9013 return 1;
9014}

int read_met_nc_3d ( const int  ncid,
const char *  varname,
const char *  varname2,
const char *  varname3,
const char *  varname4,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
const met_t *  met,
dd_t *  dd,
float  dest[EX][EY][EP],
const float  scl 
)

Reads a 3-dimensional meteorological variable from a NetCDF file.

This function reads a 3-dimensional meteorological variable from a NetCDF file and stores it in a specified destination array. It supports both packed and unpacked data formats and handles missing values and scaling factors accordingly. The function also checks the meteorological data layout to ensure correct data copying.

Parameters
ncidThe NetCDF file ID.
varnameThe name of the variable to read.
varname2An alternative name of the variable to read (in case varname is not found).
varname3An alternative name of the variable to read (in case varname2 is not found).
varname4An alternative name of the variable to read (in case varname3 is not found).
varname5An alternative name of the variable to read (in case varname4 is not found).
varname6An alternative name of the variable to read (in case varname5 is not found).
ctlA pointer to a structure containing control parameters.
metA pointer to a structure containing meteorological data.
destThe destination array to store the read data.
sclA scaling factor to apply to the read data.
Returns
Returns 1 on success, 0 on failure.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Checks if the specified variable exists in the NetCDF file.
  • Reads packed data if scaling factors are available, otherwise reads unpacked data.
  • Handles missing values and scaling factors appropriately.
  • Copies the data to the destination array, applying the scaling factor if provided.
Author
Lars Hoffmann
