write_met_bin_2d
void write_met_bin_2d(FILE *out, met_t *met, float var[EX][EY], const char *varname)
Writes a 2-dimensional meteorological variable to a binary file.
Definition: mptrac.c:12627
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ write_met_bin_2d()

void write_met_bin_2d ( FILE *  out,
met_t *  met,
float  var[EX][EY],
const char *  varname 
)

Writes a 2-dimensional meteorological variable to a binary file.

The write_met_bin_2d function writes a 2-dimensional meteorological variable to a binary file specified by the out parameter. The variable data is provided in a 2-dimensional array var with maximum dimensions EX by EY. The variable name is provided as a string in the varname parameter.

Parameters
outA pointer to a FILE structure representing the output file.
metA pointer to a met_t structure containing meteorological data.
varAn array of floats representing the 2-dimensional variable data.
varnameA string containing the name of the variable being written.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Allocates memory for a temporary buffer to hold the variable data.
  • Copies the variable data from the 2-dimensional array var to the temporary buffer help.
  • Writes the uncompressed variable data to the binary file specified by out.
  • Logs a message indicating the successful writing of the variable data.
  • Frees the allocated memory.
Note
This function is typically used to write surface data or other 2-dimensional meteorological variables to a binary file.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 12627 of file mptrac.c.

12631 {
12632
12633 float *help;
12634
12635 /* Allocate... */
12636 ALLOC(help, float,
12637 EX * EY);
12638
12639 /* Copy data... */
12640 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
12641 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
12642 help[ARRAY_2D(ix, iy, met->ny)] = var[ix][iy];
12643
12644 /* Write uncompressed data... */
12645 LOG(2, "Write 2-D variable: %s (uncompressed)", varname);
12646 FWRITE(help, float,
12647 (size_t) (met->nx * met->ny),
12648 out);
12649
12650 /* Free... */
12651 free(help);
12652}

◆ write_met_bin_3d()

void write_met_bin_3d ( FILE *  out,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met,
float  var[EX][EY][EP],
const char *  varname,
const int  precision,
const double  tolerance 
)

Writes a 3-dimensional meteorological variable to a binary file.

The write_met_bin_3d function writes a 3-dimensional meteorological variable to a binary file specified by the out parameter. The variable data is provided in a 3-dimensional array var with maximum dimensions EX by EY by EP. The variable name is provided as a string in the varname parameter. Additionally, the function takes parameters for specifying the compression precision and tolerance.

Parameters
outA pointer to a FILE structure representing the output file.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure containing control parameters.
metA pointer to a met_t structure containing meteorological data.
varAn array of floats representing the 3-dimensional variable data.
varnameA string containing the name of the variable being written.
precisionAn integer specifying the precision of compression (for certain compression methods).
toleranceA double specifying the tolerance for compression (for certain compression methods).

The function performs the following steps:

  • Allocates memory for a temporary buffer to hold the variable data.
  • Copies the variable data from the 3-dimensional array var to the temporary buffer help.
  • Writes the variable data to the binary file specified by out using the specified compression method (uncompressed, packed, ZFP, ZSTD, cmultiscale).
  • Logs a message indicating the successful writing of the variable data.
  • Frees the allocated memory.
Note
This function is typically used to write level data or other 3-dimensional meteorological variables to a binary file.
Depending on the value of ctl->met_type, the function writes the variable data using different compression methods. If ctl->met_type is not supported, an error message is logged.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 12656 of file mptrac.c.

12663 {
12664
12665 float *help;
12666
12667 /* Allocate... */
12668 ALLOC(help, float,
12669 EX * EY * EP);
12670
12671 /* Copy data... */
12672#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) collapse(2)
12673 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
12674 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
12675 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
12676 help[ARRAY_3D(ix, iy, met->ny, ip, met->np)] = var[ix][iy][ip];
12677
12678 /* Write uncompressed data... */
12679 if (ctl->met_type == 1) {
12680 LOG(2, "Write 3-D variable: %s (uncompressed)", varname);
12681 FWRITE(help, float,
12682 (size_t) (met->nx * met->ny * met->np),
12683 out);
12684 }
12685
12686 /* Write packed data... */
12687 else if (ctl->met_type == 2)
12688 compress_pck(varname, help, (size_t) (met->ny * met->nx),
12689 (size_t) met->np, 0, out);
12690
12691 /* Write ZFP data... */
12692#ifdef ZFP
12693 else if (ctl->met_type == 3) {
12694 FWRITE(&precision, int,
12695 1,
12696 out);
12697 FWRITE(&tolerance, double,
12698 1,
12699 out);
12700 compress_zfp(varname, help, met->np, met->ny, met->nx, precision,
12701 tolerance, 0, out);
12702 }
12703#endif
12704
12705 /* Write zstd data... */
12706#ifdef ZSTD
12707 else if (ctl->met_type == 4)
12708 compress_zstd(varname, help, (size_t) (met->np * met->ny * met->nx), 0,
12709 ctl->met_zstd_level, out);
12710#endif
12711
12712 /* Write cmultiscale data... */
12713#ifdef CMS
12714 else if (ctl->met_type == 5) {
12715 compress_cms(ctl, varname, help, (size_t) met->nx, (size_t) met->ny,
12716 (size_t) met->np, 0, out);
12717 }
12718#endif
12719
12720 /* Write SZ3 data... */
12721#ifdef SZ3
12722 else if (ctl->met_type == 7) {
12723 FWRITE(&precision, int,
12724 1,
12725 out);
12726 FWRITE(&tolerance, double,
12727 1,
12728 out);
12729 compress_sz3(varname, help, met->np, met->ny, met->nx, precision,
12730 tolerance, 0, out);
12731 }
12732#endif
12733
12734 /* Unknown method... */
12735 else {
12736 ERRMSG("MET_TYPE not supported!");
12737 LOG(3, "%d %g", precision, tolerance);
12738 }
12739
12740 /* Free... */
12741 free(help);
12742}
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ write_met_nc()

void write_met_nc ( const char *  filename,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met 
)

Writes meteorological data to a NetCDF file.

This function creates and writes meteorological data to a NetCDF file in the NetCDF-4 format. It defines the required dimensions, grid, surface variables, and level data within the NetCDF structure and writes the corresponding values from the met_t structure. The function uses helper functions to write 2D surface and 3D level data.

Parameters
filenameA constant character pointer representing the name of the NetCDF file to create and write the data to.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure that contains control parameters, such as the NetCDF level and quantization settings.
metA pointer to a met_t structure that contains the meteorological data to be written to the NetCDF file.
Note
  • The function uses the NetCDF-4 format for efficient data storage.
  • It defines the grid dimensions (time, longitude, latitude, pressure levels) and adds global attributes like units and descriptions for each variable.
  • The surface variables include surface pressure, geopotential, 2-meter temperature, and wind components, which are defined on a 2D grid (latitude × longitude).
  • The level variables, such as temperature, wind velocities, and cloud properties, are defined on a 3D grid (pressure level × latitude × longitude).
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 12746 of file mptrac.c.

12851 ctl->met_nc_level, ctl->met_nc_quant);
12852
12853 /* End definitions... */
12854 NC(nc_enddef(ncid));
12855
12856 /* Write grid data... */
12857 NC_PUT_DOUBLE("time", &met->time, 0);
12858 NC_PUT_DOUBLE("lon", met->lon, 0);
12859 NC_PUT_DOUBLE("lat", met->lat, 0);
12860 double phelp[EP];
12861 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
12862 phelp[ip] = 100. * met->p[ip];
12863 NC_PUT_DOUBLE("lev", phelp, 0);
12864
12865 /* Write surface data... */
12866 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "sp", met, met->ps, 100.0f);
12867 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "z", met, met->zs, (float) (1000. * G0));
12868 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "t2m", met, met->ts, 1.0f);
12869 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "u10m", met, met->us, 1.0f);
12870 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "v10m", met, met->vs, 1.0f);
12871 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "iews", met, met->ess, 1.0f);
12872 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "inss", met, met->nss, 1.0f);
12873 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "ishf", met, met->shf, 1.0f);
12874 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "lsm", met, met->lsm, 1.0f);
12875 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "sstk", met, met->sst, 1.0f);
12876 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "blp", met, met->pbl, 100.0f);
12877 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "pt", met, met->pt, 100.0f);
12878 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "tt", met, met->tt, 1.0f);
12879 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "zt", met, met->zt, 1000.0f);
12880 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "h2ot", met, met->h2ot, 1.0f);
12881 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "pct", met, met->pct, 100.0f);
12882 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "pcb", met, met->pcb, 100.0f);
12883 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "cl", met, met->cl, 1.0f);
12884 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "plcl", met, met->plcl, 100.0f);
12885 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "plfc", met, met->plfc, 100.0f);
12886 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "pel", met, met->pel, 100.0f);
12887 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "cape", met, met->cape, 1.0f);
12888 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "cin", met, met->cin, 1.0f);
12889 write_met_nc_2d(ncid, "o3c", met, met->o3c, 1.0f);
12890
12891 /* Write level data... */
12892 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "t", met, met->t, 1.0f);
12893 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "u", met, met->u, 1.0f);
12894 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "v", met, met->v, 1.0f);
12895 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "w", met, met->w, 100.0f);
12896 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "q", met, met->h2o, (float) (MH2O / MA));
12897 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "o3", met, met->o3, (float) (MO3 / MA));
12898 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "clwc", met, met->lwc, 1.0f);
12899 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "crwc", met, met->rwc, 1.0f);
12900 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "ciwc", met, met->iwc, 1.0f);
12901 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "cswc", met, met->swc, 1.0f);
12902 write_met_nc_3d(ncid, "cc", met, met->cc, 1.0f);
12903
12904 /* Close file... */
12905 NC(nc_close(ncid));
12906}
write_met_nc_2d
void write_met_nc_2d(const int ncid, const char *varname, met_t *met, float var[EX][EY], const float scl)
Writes a 2D meteorological variable to a NetCDF file.
Definition: mptrac.c:12910
write_met_nc_3d
void write_met_nc_3d(const int ncid, const char *varname, met_t *met, float var[EX][EY][EP], const float scl)
Writes a 3D meteorological variable to a NetCDF file.
Definition: mptrac.c:12939
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ write_met_nc_2d()

void write_met_nc_2d ( const int  ncid,
const char *  varname,
met_t *  met,
float  var[EX][EY],
const float  scl 
)

Writes a 2D meteorological variable to a NetCDF file.

This function writes a 2D meteorological variable, stored in the array var, to a NetCDF file with the specified variable name. The data is scaled by a factor scl before being written. The function handles memory allocation for the data copy, scaling, and freeing the allocated memory after writing the data to the NetCDF file.

Parameters
ncidThe NetCDF file ID. This is an integer that identifies the NetCDF file where the data will be written. It is assumed that this file has already been opened for writing.
varnameA pointer to a string containing the name of the variable in the NetCDF file where the data will be stored.
metA pointer to a structure of type met_t that contains metadata about the meteorological field, including the dimensions nx (number of points in x-direction) and ny (number of points in y-direction).
varA 2D array of dimensions EX x EY containing the meteorological data to be written. The data is provided in the format var[ix][iy], where ix is the index in the x-direction and iy is the index in the y-direction.
sclA scaling factor applied to each element in the var array before writing to the NetCDF file.
Returns
void This function does not return any value.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 12910 of file mptrac.c.

12915 {
12916
12917 int varid;
12918 size_t start[4], count[4];
12919
12920 /* Allocate... */
12921 float *help;
12922 ALLOC(help, float,
12923 EX * EY);
12924
12925 /* Copy data... */
12926 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
12927 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
12928 help[ARRAY_2D(iy, ix, met->nx)] = scl * var[ix][iy];
12929
12930 /* Write data... */
12931 NC_PUT_FLOAT(varname, help, 0);
12932
12933 /* Free... */
12934 free(help);
12935}
NC_PUT_FLOAT
#define NC_PUT_FLOAT(varname, ptr, hyperslab)
Write a float array to a NetCDF file.

◆ write_met_nc_3d()

void write_met_nc_3d ( const int  ncid,
const char *  varname,
met_t *  met,
float  var[EX][EY][EP],
const float  scl 
)

Writes a 3D meteorological variable to a NetCDF file.

This function writes a 3D meteorological variable, stored in the array var, to a NetCDF file with the specified variable name. The data is scaled by a factor scl before being written. The function handles memory allocation for the data copy, scaling, and freeing the allocated memory after writing the data to the NetCDF file.

Parameters
ncidThe NetCDF file ID. This is an integer that identifies the NetCDF file where the data will be written. It is assumed that this file has already been opened for writing.
varnameA pointer to a string containing the name of the variable in the NetCDF file where the data will be stored.
metA pointer to a structure of type met_t that contains metadata about the meteorological field, including the dimensions nx (number of points in the x-direction), ny (number of points in the y-direction), and np (number of points in the third dimension, e.g., pressure levels).
varA 3D array of dimensions EX x EY x EP containing the meteorological data to be written. The data is provided in the format var[ix][iy][ip], where ix is the index in the x-direction, iy is the index in the y-direction, and ip is the index in the third dimension (e.g., vertical levels).
sclA scaling factor applied to each element in the var array before writing to the NetCDF file.
Returns
void This function does not return any value.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 12939 of file mptrac.c.

12944 {
12945
12946 int varid;
12947 size_t start[4], count[4];
12948
12949 /* Allocate... */
12950 float *help;
12951 ALLOC(help, float,
12952 EX * EY * EP);
12953
12954 /* Copy data... */
12955 for (int ix = 0; ix < met->nx; ix++)
12956 for (int iy = 0; iy < met->ny; iy++)
12957 for (int ip = 0; ip < met->np; ip++)
12958 help[ARRAY_3D(ip, iy, met->ny, ix, met->nx)] = scl * var[ix][iy][ip];
12959
12960 /* Write data... */
12961 NC_PUT_FLOAT(varname, help, 0);
12962
12963 /* Free... */
12964 free(help);
12965}

◆ write_prof()

void write_prof ( const char *  filename,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
const atm_t *  atm,
const double  t 
)

Writes profile data to a specified file.

The write_prof function writes profile data to a file specified by the filename parameter. It takes control parameters (ctl), two meteorological data structures (met0 and met1), an atmospheric data structure (atm), and a time value (t) as input.

Parameters
filenameA string representing the filename where the profile data will be written.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure containing control parameters.
met0A pointer to a met_t structure representing the first set of meteorological data.
met1A pointer to a met_t structure representing the second set of meteorological data.
atmA pointer to an atm_t structure representing atmospheric data.
tA double value representing the time at which the profile data is being written.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Initializes variables and allocates memory if it's the start of the simulation.
  • Reads observation data and creates a new output file if necessary.
  • Writes header information to the output file.
  • Sets grid box size and vertical coordinates.
  • Processes observations and model data within the specified time interval.
  • Calculates and writes output data for each grid cell.
  • Finalizes by closing the output file and freeing allocated memory if it's the end of the simulation.
Note
This function writes profile data to a file, including time, altitude, coordinates, atmospheric properties, observed data, and the number of observations.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 12969 of file mptrac.c.

12975 {
12976
12977 static FILE *out;
12978
12979 static double *mass, *obsmean, *rt, *rz, *rlon, *rlat, *robs, *area,
12980 dz, dlon, dlat, *lon, *lat, *z, *press, temp, vmr, h2o, o3;
12981
12982 static int nobs, *obscount, ip, okay;
12983
12984 /* Set timer... */
12985 SELECT_TIMER("WRITE_PROF", "OUTPUT", NVTX_WRITE);
12986
12987 /* Init... */
12988 if (t == ctl->t_start) {
12989
12990 /* Check quantity index for mass... */
12991 if (ctl->qnt_m < 0)
12992 ERRMSG("Need quantity mass!");
12993
12994 /* Check molar mass... */
12995 if (ctl->molmass <= 0)
12996 ERRMSG("Specify molar mass!");
12997
12998 /* Allocate... */
12999 ALLOC(lon, double,
13000 ctl->prof_nx);
13001 ALLOC(lat, double,
13002 ctl->prof_ny);
13003 ALLOC(area, double,
13004 ctl->prof_ny);
13005 ALLOC(z, double,
13006 ctl->prof_nz);
13007 ALLOC(press, double,
13008 ctl->prof_nz);
13009 ALLOC(rt, double,
13010 NOBS);
13011 ALLOC(rz, double,
13012 NOBS);
13013 ALLOC(rlon, double,
13014 NOBS);
13015 ALLOC(rlat, double,
13016 NOBS);
13017 ALLOC(robs, double,
13018 NOBS);
13019
13020 /* Read observation data... */
13021 read_obs(ctl->prof_obsfile, ctl, rt, rz, rlon, rlat, robs, &nobs);
13022
13023 /* Create new output file... */
13024 LOG(1, "Write profile data: %s", filename);
13025 if (!(out = fopen(filename, "w")))
13026 ERRMSG("Cannot create file!");
13027
13028 /* Write header... */
13029 fprintf(out,
13030 "# $1 = time [s]\n"
13031 "# $2 = altitude [km]\n"
13032 "# $3 = longitude [deg]\n"
13033 "# $4 = latitude [deg]\n"
13034 "# $5 = pressure [hPa]\n"
13035 "# $6 = temperature [K]\n"
13036 "# $7 = volume mixing ratio [ppv]\n"
13037 "# $8 = H2O volume mixing ratio [ppv]\n"
13038 "# $9 = O3 volume mixing ratio [ppv]\n"
13039 "# $10 = observed BT index [K]\n"
13040 "# $11 = number of observations\n");
13041
13042 /* Set grid box size... */
13043 dz = (ctl->prof_z1 - ctl->prof_z0) / ctl->prof_nz;
13044 dlon = (ctl->prof_lon1 - ctl->prof_lon0) / ctl->prof_nx;
13045 dlat = (ctl->prof_lat1 - ctl->prof_lat0) / ctl->prof_ny;
13046
13047 /* Set vertical coordinates... */
13048 for (int iz = 0; iz < ctl->prof_nz; iz++) {
13049 z[iz] = ctl->prof_z0 + dz * (iz + 0.5);
13050 press[iz] = P(z[iz]);
13051 }
13052
13053 /* Set horizontal coordinates... */
13054 for (int ix = 0; ix < ctl->prof_nx; ix++)
13055 lon[ix] = ctl->prof_lon0 + dlon * (ix + 0.5);
13056 for (int iy = 0; iy < ctl->prof_ny; iy++) {
13057 lat[iy] = ctl->prof_lat0 + dlat * (iy + 0.5);
13058 area[iy] = dlat * dlon * SQR(RE * M_PI / 180.) * cos(DEG2RAD(lat[iy]));
13059 }
13060 }
13061
13062 /* Set time interval... */
13063 const double t0 = t - 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
13064 const double t1 = t + 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
13065
13066 /* Allocate... */
13067 ALLOC(mass, double,
13068 ctl->prof_nx * ctl->prof_ny * ctl->prof_nz);
13069 ALLOC(obsmean, double,
13070 ctl->prof_nx * ctl->prof_ny);
13071 ALLOC(obscount, int,
13072 ctl->prof_nx * ctl->prof_ny);
13073
13074 /* Loop over observations... */
13075 for (int i = 0; i < nobs; i++) {
13076
13077 /* Check time... */
13078 if (rt[i] < t0)
13079 continue;
13080 else if (rt[i] >= t1)
13081 break;
13082
13083 /* Check observation data... */
13084 if (!isfinite(robs[i]))
13085 continue;
13086
13087 /* Calculate indices... */
13088 const int ix = (int) ((rlon[i] - ctl->prof_lon0) / dlon);
13089 const int iy = (int) ((rlat[i] - ctl->prof_lat0) / dlat);
13090
13091 /* Check indices... */
13092 if (ix < 0 || ix >= ctl->prof_nx || iy < 0 || iy >= ctl->prof_ny)
13093 continue;
13094
13095 /* Get mean observation index... */
13096 const int idx = ARRAY_2D(ix, iy, ctl->prof_ny);
13097 obsmean[idx] += robs[i];
13098 obscount[idx]++;
13099 }
13100
13101 /* Analyze model data... */
13102 for (ip = 0; ip < atm->np; ip++) {
13103
13104 /* Check time... */
13105 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1)
13106 continue;
13107
13108 /* Get indices... */
13109 const int ix = (int) ((atm->lon[ip] - ctl->prof_lon0) / dlon);
13110 const int iy = (int) ((atm->lat[ip] - ctl->prof_lat0) / dlat);
13111 const int iz = (int) ((Z(atm->p[ip]) - ctl->prof_z0) / dz);
13112
13113 /* Check indices... */
13114 if (ix < 0 || ix >= ctl->prof_nx ||
13115 iy < 0 || iy >= ctl->prof_ny || iz < 0 || iz >= ctl->prof_nz)
13116 continue;
13117
13118 /* Get total mass in grid cell... */
13119 const int idx = ARRAY_3D(ix, iy, ctl->prof_ny, iz, ctl->prof_nz);
13120 mass[idx] += atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip];
13121 }
13122
13123 /* Extract profiles... */
13124 for (int ix = 0; ix < ctl->prof_nx; ix++)
13125 for (int iy = 0; iy < ctl->prof_ny; iy++) {
13126 int idx2 = ARRAY_2D(ix, iy, ctl->prof_ny);
13127 if (obscount[idx2] > 0) {
13128
13129 /* Check profile... */
13130 okay = 0;
13131 for (int iz = 0; iz < ctl->prof_nz; iz++) {
13132 int idx3 = ARRAY_3D(ix, iy, ctl->prof_ny, iz, ctl->prof_nz);
13133 if (mass[idx3] > 0) {
13134 okay = 1;
13135 break;
13136 }
13137 }
13138 if (!okay)
13139 continue;
13140
13141 /* Write output... */
13142 fprintf(out, "\n");
13143
13144 /* Loop over altitudes... */
13145 for (int iz = 0; iz < ctl->prof_nz; iz++) {
13146
13147 /* Get temperature, water vapor, and ozone... */
13148 INTPOL_INIT;
13149 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->t, met1, met1->t, t, press[iz],
13150 lon[ix], lat[iy], &temp, ci, cw, 1);
13151 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->h2o, met1, met1->h2o, t, press[iz],
13152 lon[ix], lat[iy], &h2o, ci, cw, 0);
13153 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->o3, met1, met1->o3, t, press[iz],
13154 lon[ix], lat[iy], &o3, ci, cw, 0);
13155
13156 /* Calculate volume mixing ratio... */
13157 const int idx3 = ARRAY_3D(ix, iy, ctl->prof_ny, iz, ctl->prof_nz);
13158 vmr = MA / ctl->molmass * mass[idx3]
13159 / (RHO(press[iz], temp) * area[iy] * dz * 1e9);
13160
13161 /* Write output... */
13162 fprintf(out, "%.2f %g %g %g %g %g %g %g %g %g %d\n",
13163 t, z[iz], lon[ix], lat[iy], press[iz], temp, vmr, h2o, o3,
13164 obsmean[idx2] / obscount[idx2], obscount[idx2]);
13165 }
13166 }
13167 }
13168
13169 /* Free... */
13170 free(mass);
13171 free(obsmean);
13172 free(obscount);
13173
13174 /* Finalize... */
13175 if (t == ctl->t_stop) {
13176
13177 /* Close output file... */
13178 fclose(out);
13179
13180 /* Free... */
13181 free(lon);
13182 free(lat);
13183 free(area);
13184 free(z);
13185 free(press);
13186 free(rt);
13187 free(rz);
13188 free(rlon);
13189 free(rlat);
13190 free(robs);
13191 }
13192}
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ write_sample()

void write_sample ( const char *  filename,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
met_t *  met0,
met_t *  met1,
const atm_t *  atm,
const double  t 
)

Writes sample data to a specified file.

The write_sample function writes sample data to a file specified by the filename parameter. It takes control parameters (ctl), two meteorological data structures (met0 and met1), an atmospheric data structure (atm), and a time value (t) as input.

Parameters
filenameA string representing the filename where the sample data will be written.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure containing control parameters.
met0A pointer to a met_t structure representing the first set of meteorological data.
met1A pointer to a met_t structure representing the second set of meteorological data.
atmA pointer to an atm_t structure representing atmospheric data.
tA double value representing the time at which the sample data is being written.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Initializes variables and allocates memory if it's the start of the simulation.
  • Reads observation data and kernel data if necessary.
  • Creates a new output file and writes header information to it.
  • Sets latitude range, squared radius, and area.
  • Processes observations and calculates sample data within the specified time interval.
  • Writes output data for each observation.
  • Finalizes by closing the output file and freeing allocated memory if it's the end of the simulation.
Note
This function writes sample data to a file, including time, altitude, coordinates, surface area, layer depth, number of particles, column density, volume mixing ratio, and observed data.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 13196 of file mptrac.c.

13202 {
13203
13204 static FILE *out;
13205
13206 static double area, dlat, rmax2, *rt, *rz, *rlon, *rlat, *robs, kz[EP],
13207 kw[EP];
13208
13209 static int nobs, nk;
13210
13211 /* Set timer... */
13212 SELECT_TIMER("WRITE_SAMPLE", "OUTPUT", NVTX_WRITE);
13213
13214 /* Init... */
13215 if (t == ctl->t_start) {
13216
13217 /* Allocate... */
13218 ALLOC(rt, double,
13219 NOBS);
13220 ALLOC(rz, double,
13221 NOBS);
13222 ALLOC(rlon, double,
13223 NOBS);
13224 ALLOC(rlat, double,
13225 NOBS);
13226 ALLOC(robs, double,
13227 NOBS);
13228
13229 /* Read observation data... */
13230 read_obs(ctl->sample_obsfile, ctl, rt, rz, rlon, rlat, robs, &nobs);
13231
13232 /* Read kernel data... */
13233 if (ctl->sample_kernel[0] != '-')
13234 read_kernel(ctl->sample_kernel, kz, kw, &nk);
13235
13236 /* Create output file... */
13237 LOG(1, "Write sample data: %s", filename);
13238 if (!(out = fopen(filename, "w")))
13239 ERRMSG("Cannot create file!");
13240
13241 /* Write header... */
13242 fprintf(out,
13243 "# $1 = time [s]\n"
13244 "# $2 = altitude [km]\n"
13245 "# $3 = longitude [deg]\n"
13246 "# $4 = latitude [deg]\n"
13247 "# $5 = surface area [km^2]\n"
13248 "# $6 = layer depth [km]\n"
13249 "# $7 = number of particles [1]\n"
13250 "# $8 = column density [kg/m^2]\n"
13251 "# $9 = volume mixing ratio [ppv]\n"
13252 "# $10 = observed BT index [K]\n\n");
13253
13254 /* Set latitude range, squared radius, and area... */
13255 dlat = DY2DEG(ctl->sample_dx);
13256 rmax2 = SQR(ctl->sample_dx);
13257 area = M_PI * rmax2;
13258 }
13259
13260 /* Set time interval for output... */
13261 const double t0 = t - 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
13262 const double t1 = t + 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
13263
13264 /* Loop over observations... */
13265 for (int i = 0; i < nobs; i++) {
13266
13267 /* Check time... */
13268 if (rt[i] < t0)
13269 continue;
13270 else if (rt[i] >= t1)
13271 break;
13272
13273 /* Calculate Cartesian coordinates... */
13274 double x0[3];
13275 geo2cart(0, rlon[i], rlat[i], x0);
13276
13277 /* Set pressure range... */
13278 const double rp = P(rz[i]);
13279 const double ptop = P(rz[i] + ctl->sample_dz);
13280 const double pbot = P(rz[i] - ctl->sample_dz);
13281
13282 /* Init... */
13283 double mass = 0;
13284 int np = 0;
13285
13286 /* Loop over air parcels... */
13287 //#pragma omp parallel for default(shared) reduction(+:mass,np)
13288 for (int ip = 0; ip < atm->np; ip++) {
13289
13290 /* Check time... */
13291 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1)
13292 continue;
13293
13294 /* Check latitude... */
13295 if (fabs(rlat[i] - atm->lat[ip]) > dlat)
13296 continue;
13297
13298 /* Check horizontal distance... */
13299 double x1[3];
13300 geo2cart(0, atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip], x1);
13301 if (DIST2(x0, x1) > rmax2)
13302 continue;
13303
13304 /* Check pressure... */
13305 if (ctl->sample_dz > 0)
13306 if (atm->p[ip] > pbot || atm->p[ip] < ptop)
13307 continue;
13308
13309 /* Add mass... */
13310 if (ctl->qnt_m >= 0)
13311 mass +=
13312 kernel_weight(kz, kw, nk, atm->p[ip]) * atm->q[ctl->qnt_m][ip];
13313 np++;
13314 }
13315
13316 /* Calculate column density... */
13317 const double cd = mass / (1e6 * area);
13318
13319 /* Calculate volume mixing ratio... */
13320 double vmr = 0;
13321 if (ctl->molmass > 0 && ctl->sample_dz > 0) {
13322 if (mass > 0) {
13323
13324 /* Get temperature... */
13325 double temp;
13326 INTPOL_INIT;
13327 intpol_met_time_3d(met0, met0->t, met1, met1->t, rt[i], rp,
13328 rlon[i], rlat[i], &temp, ci, cw, 1);
13329
13330 /* Calculate volume mixing ratio... */
13331 vmr = MA / ctl->molmass * cd / (RHO(rp, temp) * ctl->sample_dz * 1e3);
13332 }
13333 } else
13334 vmr = NAN;
13335
13336 /* Write output... */
13337 fprintf(out, "%.2f %g %g %g %g %g %d %g %g %g\n", rt[i], rz[i],
13338 rlon[i], rlat[i], area, ctl->sample_dz, np, cd, vmr, robs[i]);
13339 }
13340
13341 /* Finalize...... */
13342 if (t == ctl->t_stop) {
13343
13344 /* Close output file... */
13345 fclose(out);
13346
13347 /* Free... */
13348 free(rt);
13349 free(rz);
13350 free(rlon);
13351 free(rlat);
13352 free(robs);
13353 }
13354}
Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ write_station()

void write_station ( const char *  filename,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
atm_t *  atm,
const double  t 
)

Writes station data to a specified file.

The write_station function writes station data to a file specified by the filename parameter. It takes control parameters (ctl), an atmospheric data structure (atm), and a time value (t) as input.

Parameters
filenameA string representing the filename where the station data will be written.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure containing control parameters.
atmA pointer to an atm_t structure representing atmospheric data.
tA double value representing the time at which the station data is being written.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Initializes variables and opens a new file if it's the start of the simulation.
  • Writes header information to the output file.
  • Sets geolocation and search radius for station data.
  • Processes air parcels and writes station data within the specified time interval and search radius.
  • Writes station data for each air parcel satisfying the criteria.
  • Closes the output file if it's the end of the simulation.
Note
This function writes station data to a file, including time, altitude, longitude, latitude, and additional quantities specified in the control parameters.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 13358 of file mptrac.c.

13362 {
13363
13364 static FILE *out;
13365
13366 static double rmax2, x0[3], x1[3];
13367
13368 /* Set timer... */
13369 SELECT_TIMER("WRITE_STATION", "OUTPUT", NVTX_WRITE);
13370
13371 /* Init... */
13372 if (t == ctl->t_start) {
13373
13374 /* Write info... */
13375 LOG(1, "Write station data: %s", filename);
13376
13377 /* Create new file... */
13378 if (!(out = fopen(filename, "w")))
13379 ERRMSG("Cannot create file!");
13380
13381 /* Write header... */
13382 fprintf(out,
13383 "# $1 = time [s]\n"
13384 "# $2 = altitude [km]\n"
13385 "# $3 = longitude [deg]\n" "# $4 = latitude [deg]\n");
13386 for (int iq = 0; iq < ctl->nq; iq++)
13387 fprintf(out, "# $%i = %s [%s]\n", (iq + 5),
13388 ctl->qnt_name[iq], ctl->qnt_unit[iq]);
13389 fprintf(out, "\n");
13390
13391 /* Set geolocation and search radius... */
13392 geo2cart(0, ctl->stat_lon, ctl->stat_lat, x0);
13393 rmax2 = SQR(ctl->stat_r);
13394 }
13395
13396 /* Set time interval for output... */
13397 const double t0 = t - 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
13398 const double t1 = t + 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
13399
13400 /* Loop over air parcels... */
13401 for (int ip = 0; ip < atm->np; ip++) {
13402
13403 /* Check time... */
13404 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1)
13405 continue;
13406
13407 /* Check time range for station output... */
13408 if (atm->time[ip] < ctl->stat_t0 || atm->time[ip] > ctl->stat_t1)
13409 continue;
13410
13411 /* Check station flag... */
13412 if (ctl->qnt_stat >= 0)
13413 if ((int) atm->q[ctl->qnt_stat][ip])
13414 continue;
13415
13416 /* Get Cartesian coordinates... */
13417 geo2cart(0, atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip], x1);
13418
13419 /* Check horizontal distance... */
13420 if (DIST2(x0, x1) > rmax2)
13421 continue;
13422
13423 /* Set station flag... */
13424 if (ctl->qnt_stat >= 0)
13425 atm->q[ctl->qnt_stat][ip] = 1;
13426
13427 /* Write data... */
13428 fprintf(out, "%.2f %g %g %g",
13429 atm->time[ip], Z(atm->p[ip]), atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip]);
13430 for (int iq = 0; iq < ctl->nq; iq++) {
13431 fprintf(out, " ");
13432 fprintf(out, ctl->qnt_format[iq], atm->q[iq][ip]);
13433 }
13434 fprintf(out, "\n");
13435 }
13436
13437 /* Close file... */
13438 if (t == ctl->t_stop)
13439 fclose(out);
13440}

◆ write_vtk()

void write_vtk ( const char *  filename,
const ctl_t *  ctl,
const atm_t *  atm,
const double  t 
)

Writes VTK (Visualization Toolkit) data to a specified file.

The write_vtk function writes VTK data to a file specified by the filename parameter. It takes control parameters (ctl), an atmospheric data structure (atm), and a time value (t) as input.

Parameters
filenameA string representing the filename where the VTK data will be written.
ctlA pointer to a ctl_t structure containing control parameters.
atmA pointer to an atm_t structure representing atmospheric data.
tA double value representing the time at which the VTK data is being written.

The function performs the following steps:

  • Sets a timer and logs information about writing VTK data.
  • Sets a time interval for output based on the specified time and control parameters.
  • Creates a new file and checks if the file creation was successful.
  • Counts the number of data points to be written.
  • Writes the VTK header, including metadata.
  • Writes point coordinates based on the sphere or Cartesian coordinate system.
  • Writes point data for each quantity specified in the control parameters.
  • Closes the output file.
Note
This function writes VTK data in ASCII format, including point coordinates and associated scalar data for visualization purposes.
Author
Lars Hoffmann

Definition at line 13444 of file mptrac.c.

13448 {
13449
13450 FILE *out;
13451
13452 /* Set timer... */
13453 SELECT_TIMER("WRITE_VTK", "OUTPUT", NVTX_WRITE);
13454
13455 /* Write info... */
13456 LOG(1, "Write VTK data: %s", filename);
13457
13458 /* Set time interval for output... */
13459 const double t0 = t - 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
13460 const double t1 = t + 0.5 * ctl->dt_mod;
13461
13462 /* Create file... */
13463 if (!(out = fopen(filename, "w")))
13464 ERRMSG("Cannot create file!");
13465
13466 /* Count data points... */
13467 int np = 0;
13468 for (int ip = 0; ip < atm->np; ip += ctl->vtk_stride) {
13469 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1)
13470 continue;
13471 np++;
13472 }
13473
13474 /* Write header... */
13475 fprintf(out,
13476 "# vtk DataFile Version 3.0\n"
13477 "vtk output\n" "ASCII\n" "DATASET POLYDATA\n");
13478
13479 /* Write point coordinates... */
13480 fprintf(out, "POINTS %d float\n", np);
13481 if (ctl->vtk_sphere) {
13482 for (int ip = 0; ip < atm->np; ip += ctl->vtk_stride) {
13483 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1)
13484 continue;
13485 const double radius = (RE + Z(atm->p[ip]) * ctl->vtk_scale
13486 + ctl->vtk_offset) / RE;
13487 const double coslat = cos(DEG2RAD(atm->lat[ip]));
13488 const double x = radius * coslat * cos(DEG2RAD(atm->lon[ip]));
13489 const double y = radius * coslat * sin(DEG2RAD(atm->lon[ip]));
13490 const double z = radius * sin(DEG2RAD(atm->lat[ip]));
13491 fprintf(out, "%g %g %g\n", x, y, z);
13492 }
13493 } else
13494 for (int ip = 0; ip < atm->np; ip += ctl->vtk_stride) {
13495 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1)
13496 continue;
13497 fprintf(out, "%g %g %g\n", atm->lon[ip], atm->lat[ip],
13498 Z(atm->p[ip]) * ctl->vtk_scale + ctl->vtk_offset);
13499 }
13500
13501 /* Write point data... */
13502 fprintf(out, "POINT_DATA %d\n", np);
13503 for (int iq = 0; iq < ctl->nq; iq++) {
13504 fprintf(out, "SCALARS %s float 1\n" "LOOKUP_TABLE default\n",
13505 ctl->qnt_name[iq]);
13506 for (int ip = 0; ip < atm->np; ip += ctl->vtk_stride) {
13507 if (atm->time[ip] < t0 || atm->time[ip] > t1)
13508 continue;
13509 fprintf(out, "%g\n", atm->q[iq][ip]);
13510 }
13511 }
13512
13513 /* Close file... */
13514 fclose(out);
13515}
